Netlify CMS

# 

<span key="620eaf43dfec4c18bc29276fa5bb2b91"><span offset-key="620eaf43dfec4c18bc29276fa5bb2b91:0">Overview</span></span>

<span key="bd5cc50bb329456da71c09d83c9d5d19"><span offset-key="bd5cc50bb329456da71c09d83c9d5d19:0">Netlify CMS is an open source content management system for your Git workflow that enables you to provide editors with a friendly UI and intuitive workflows. You can use it with any static site generator to create faster, more flexible web projects. Content is stored in your Git repository alongside your code for easier versioning, multi-channel publishing, and the option to handle content updates directly in Git.</span></span>

<span key="b66ac56b82f64656bf8047eb13d2355d"><span offset-key="b66ac56b82f64656bf8047eb13d2355d:0">At its core, Netlify CMS is an open-source React app that acts as a wrapper for the Git workflow, using the GitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket API. This provides many advantages, including:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="8179874cd1cd4f89ab55da78c0589d1d">**Fast, web-based UI:**<span offset-key="8179874cd1cd4f89ab55da78c0589d1d:1"> With rich-text editing, real-time preview, and drag-and-drop media uploads.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="ac724d1d72ac4bce8f5941f53330bc04">**Platform agnostic:**<span offset-key="ac724d1d72ac4bce8f5941f53330bc04:1"> Works with most static site generators.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="76f094df952a4d82875a9bcfcbff6806">**Easy installation:**<span offset-key="76f094df952a4d82875a9bcfcbff6806:1"> Add two files to your site and hook up the backend by including those files in your build process or linking to our Content Delivery Network (CDN).</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="a0826d1959a841af9f0f541f131cf24d">**Modern authentication:**<span offset-key="a0826d1959a841af9f0f541f131cf24d:1"> Using GitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket and JSON web tokens.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="fb2bd82f3e1747a99cc4499bdec5b309">**Flexible content types:**<span offset-key="fb2bd82f3e1747a99cc4499bdec5b309:1"> Specify an unlimited number of content types with custom fields.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="8b7ecc33497d4f1a800010888b50d674">**Fully extensible:**<span offset-key="8b7ecc33497d4f1a800010888b50d674:1"> Create custom-styled previews, UI widgets, and editor plugins.</span></span>

## 

<span key="2fa036a7d98b4434800fe75ec38700d0"><span offset-key="2fa036a7d98b4434800fe75ec38700d0:0">Netlify CMS vs. Netlify</span></span>

<span key="a4930f344a414871a03c4189108533a7"><span offset-key="a4930f344a414871a03c4189108533a7:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.netlify.com" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="37c939cbf9804afca325309d83558545" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="c3bc863be4424354b4fc9a0749099d12"><span data-offset-key="c3bc863be4424354b4fc9a0749099d12:0">Netlify.com</span></span></span></a><span key="4f53ba34193741749eb7a6b5cd7325a5"><span offset-key="4f53ba34193741749eb7a6b5cd7325a5:0"> is a platform you can use to automatically build, deploy, serve, and manage your frontend sites and web apps. It also provides a variety of other features like form processing, serverless functions, and split testing. Not all Netlify sites use Netlify CMS, and not all sites using Netlify CMS are on Netlify.</span></span>

<span key="1763cf2648d04895abb6b580dd000bfe"><span offset-key="1763cf2648d04895abb6b580dd000bfe:0">The folks at Netlify created Netlify CMS to fill a gap in the static site generation pipeline. There were some great proprietary headless CMS options, but no real contenders that were open source and extensible—that could turn into a community-built ecosystem like WordPress or Drupal. For that reason, Netlify CMS is </span>*made*<span offset-key="1763cf2648d04895abb6b580dd000bfe:2"> to be community-driven, and has never been locked to the Netlify platform (despite the name).</span></span>

<span key="3d39ee59d6664e72983939ec8c127e84"><span offset-key="3d39ee59d6664e72983939ec8c127e84:0">With this in mind, you can:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="42d1846e730748e38f4e48e987911ba7"><span offset-key="42d1846e730748e38f4e48e987911ba7:0">Use Netlify CMS without Netlify and deploy your site where you always have, hooking up your own CI, site hosting, CDN, etc.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="b96333e94c1a490ab610d2eefdf968fc"><span offset-key="b96333e94c1a490ab610d2eefdf968fc:0">Use Netlify without Netlify CMS and edit your static site in your code editor.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="1213312c0bd540928ec136c4827cf77c"><span offset-key="1213312c0bd540928ec136c4827cf77c:0">Or, use them together and have a fully-working CMS-enabled site with </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/start-with-a-template/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="8a8113dda17a4fc8ad9a26e974a6d690" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="15dba89642d247398d5d1814e523c769"><span data-offset-key="15dba89642d247398d5d1814e523c769:0">one click</span></span></span></a><span key="aacda28ca86c4f7eac35f5c15ac16817"><span offset-key="aacda28ca86c4f7eac35f5c15ac16817:0">!</span></span>

<span key="e605bac86b1b474bab44c2a402450b7d"><span offset-key="e605bac86b1b474bab44c2a402450b7d:0">If you hook up Netlify CMS to your website, you're basically adding a tool for content editors to make commits to your site repository without touching code or learning Git.</span></span>

### 

<span key="c1c39eb795d0465db7afc91f6bcda94c"><span offset-key="c1c39eb795d0465db7afc91f6bcda94c:0">Find out more</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="43149ff97f524b03a662ee2dfcb371e9"><span offset-key="43149ff97f524b03a662ee2dfcb371e9:0">Get a feel for the UI in the </span></span><a href="https://cms-demo.netlify.com" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="62a5bb2faaca462d86b5347b129b067c" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="59a759bce732441595cc694c90682bb1"><span data-offset-key="59a759bce732441595cc694c90682bb1:0">demo site</span></span></span></a><span key="9dde67aec65648e48ab5bce5261942ec"><span offset-key="9dde67aec65648e48ab5bce5261942ec:0">. (No login required. Click the login button to go straight to the CMS editor UI.)</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="4d557cbaea804a19a94714d42539bd53"><span offset-key="4d557cbaea804a19a94714d42539bd53:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/start-with-a-template/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="0b0e852ba4e349f0b54ecb394b812038" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="fc097117e2be4ef3b3f496959afec594"><span data-offset-key="fc097117e2be4ef3b3f496959afec594:0">Start with a template</span></span></span></a><span key="672bcc5332134f0abad225f343c01faf"><span offset-key="672bcc5332134f0abad225f343c01faf:0"> to make a Netlify CMS-enabled site of your own.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="bfefa674a8f247dfbdca0c7dec48d579"><span offset-key="bfefa674a8f247dfbdca0c7dec48d579:0">Configure your existing site by following a </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/add-to-your-site/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="da0df66671bf4ff5a771633e41d4e666" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="782bd66298e44db186b9e4d4836cf56f"><span data-offset-key="782bd66298e44db186b9e4d4836cf56f:0">tutorial</span></span></span></a><span key="81e64957905945b0adf4fb025e90cbeb"><span offset-key="81e64957905945b0adf4fb025e90cbeb:0"> or checking </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/configuration-options" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a0165599d6e742b2a58556d19a319731" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="705257820f474a24a72b99576c83db65"><span data-offset-key="705257820f474a24a72b99576c83db65:0">configuration options</span></span></span></a><span key="3d0161426d2c410e924c8d1937466a81"><span offset-key="3d0161426d2c410e924c8d1937466a81:0">.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="1cdf1ad17588473f9b26e2ee851d7421"><span offset-key="1cdf1ad17588473f9b26e2ee851d7421:0">Ask questions and share ideas in the Netlify CMS </span></span><a href="https://netlifycms.org/chat" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="40c19c3c5fe0468eb4997e1a9194c502" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="0bad90f68ff6461f972ef59d37023350"><span data-offset-key="0bad90f68ff6461f972ef59d37023350:0">community chat</span></span></span></a><span key="3f990b009bff4887929ff63d476bdd37"><span offset-key="3f990b009bff4887929ff63d476bdd37:0">.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm" />

    <span key="cc586332aa7345548674565f5fa61b50"><span offset-key="cc586332aa7345548674565f5fa61b50:0">Get involved in new developments and become a </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/contributor-guide/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="fddbd80e99ef40f7b2359887cc5d10b8" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="9e1c0afc3750465fbff2d7cca1308090"><span data-offset-key="9e1c0afc3750465fbff2d7cca1308090:0">contributor</span></span></span></a><span key="c2137c00d0984ce3b1df36f468cd17d3"><span offset-key="c2137c00d0984ce3b1df36f468cd17d3:0">.</span></span>

# 

<span key="6d108feb197e4904bd910d72e95d0c30"><span offset-key="6d108feb197e4904bd910d72e95d0c30:0">Beta Features!</span></span>

<span key="9e72944e293542b18b3f78e2522ba063"><span offset-key="9e72944e293542b18b3f78e2522ba063:0">We run new functionality in an open beta format from time to time. That means that this functionality is totally available for use, and we </span>*think*<span offset-key="9e72944e293542b18b3f78e2522ba063:2"> it might be ready for primetime, but it could break or change without notice.</span></span>

<span key="4661d888c62c48a8a057981fa028e5f4">**Use these features at your own risk.**</span>

## 

<span key="1f97c678231e4d40a49437dcb41e636a"><span offset-key="1f97c678231e4d40a49437dcb41e636a:0">Working with a Local Git Repository</span></span>

<span key="fded139d918443a1a104f5ea9b767819">*\*\*added in \*\**</span><a href="../../../cdn-cgi/l/email-protection.html#2c42495840454a55014f415f6c1e021d1c021d1b" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="04c9b4538c93413cb903351b5a3e057c" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="b4760cc4cd45412389a2157f2629406b"><strong><em><span class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="553b3021393c332c7836382615677b64657b6462">[email protected]</span></em></strong></span></span></a><span key="74dce27dff6049bca7e820e930c150d1">*\*\* / \*\**</span><a href="../../../cdn-cgi/l/email-protection.html#137d76677f7a756a3e707e603e72636353213d22223d2227" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="3730cf4ee6f244dbb1ebd24d55416e7f" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="db8e4c8399b548949f572c85467a2e6f"><strong><em><span class="__cf_email__" data-cfemail="fe909b8a92979887d39d938dd39f8e8ebeccd0cfcfd0cfca">[email protected]</span></em></strong></span></span></a><span key="9ce52d2ffc474708ba1709f18dcc0902"><span offset-key="9ce52d2ffc474708ba1709f18dcc0902:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

<span key="f90d126f5bf74db496783010e0c04d87"><span offset-key="f90d126f5bf74db496783010e0c04d87:0">You can connect Netlify CMS to a local Git repository, instead of working with a live repo.</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="9820b1791e4f4e7f9d6971acdc6c482b"><span offset-key="9820b1791e4f4e7f9d6971acdc6c482b:0">Navigate to a local Git repository configured with the CMS.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="07ed4eeae78a48f083fc1a18e9832459"><span offset-key="07ed4eeae78a48f083fc1a18e9832459:0">Add the top-level property </span>`local_backend`<span offset-key="07ed4eeae78a48f083fc1a18e9832459:2"> configuration to your </span>`config.yml`<span offset-key="07ed4eeae78a48f083fc1a18e9832459:4">:</span></span>

1

<span key="a1761679775e45e59d2648b8fbcca0d5"><span offset-key="a1761679775e45e59d2648b8fbcca0d5:0">backend:</span></span>

2

<span key="2c52d86dedc04f4b996d3b334f1b8171"><span offset-key="2c52d86dedc04f4b996d3b334f1b8171:0"> name: git-gateway</span></span>

3

<span key="88d305a8181244e9b20832b63bcdcd5f"><span offset-key="88d305a8181244e9b20832b63bcdcd5f:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

4

<span key="cc73622d13a04df9b79b3e2ad169ab24"><span offset-key="cc73622d13a04df9b79b3e2ad169ab24:0"># when using the default proxy server port</span></span>

5

<span key="f946b0d6e39146148a4ce698ef2e96f6"><span offset-key="f946b0d6e39146148a4ce698ef2e96f6:0">local\_backend: true</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7" />

Copied!

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="2595e7b993a646fb9c375433f4f21eba"><span offset-key="2595e7b993a646fb9c375433f4f21eba:0">Run </span>`npx netlify-cms-proxy-server`<span offset-key="2595e7b993a646fb9c375433f4f21eba:2"> from the root directory of the above repository.</span></span>

    -   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

        <span key="072e78052fb44dea8f2b0d30b73382c6"><span offset-key="072e78052fb44dea8f2b0d30b73382c6:0">If the default port (8081) is in use, the proxy server won't start and you will see an error message. In this case, follow </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/beta-features/#configure-the-netlify-cms-proxy-server-port-number" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="5b622209c5cc4a148d89bceb070439cd" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="de76caa5b6cd444aa5c7c59afd42e201"><span data-offset-key="de76caa5b6cd444aa5c7c59afd42e201:0">these steps</span></span></span></a><span key="a056b64c519442cd883c415869d91ff3"><span offset-key="a056b64c519442cd883c415869d91ff3:0"> before proceeding.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="86bfd1c00223490986b04d178b7c7ec8"><span offset-key="86bfd1c00223490986b04d178b7c7ec8:0">Start your local development server (e.g. run </span>`gatsby develop`<span offset-key="86bfd1c00223490986b04d178b7c7ec8:2">).</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="c3de4acf5a1d4e5e9968cc1c5a570dce"><span offset-key="c3de4acf5a1d4e5e9968cc1c5a570dce:0">Open </span></span><a href="http://localhost:8000/admin" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="78b77f23c6eb4a5d914fe0aced2a5a6b" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="75b99da9ca9c495abcb73d54c20951d2"><span data-offset-key="75b99da9ca9c495abcb73d54c20951d2:0">http://localhost:8000/admin</span></span></span></a><span key="aa2cf3c30ae0407092c8917462f56a40"><span offset-key="aa2cf3c30ae0407092c8917462f56a40:0"> to verify that your can administer your content locally.</span></span>

<span key="e7d2dbada6cc40cdb143469cf4140280">**Note:**<span offset-key="e7d2dbada6cc40cdb143469cf4140280:1"> </span>`netlify-cms-proxy-server`<span offset-key="e7d2dbada6cc40cdb143469cf4140280:3"> runs an unauthenticated express server. As any client can send requests to the server, it should only be used for local development.</span></span>

###

## 

<span key="4d218dd589494a68851201b3a83247de"><span offset-key="4d218dd589494a68851201b3a83247de:0">i18n Support</span></span>

<span key="2931d7f359c1493684a41eb0baa657cb"><span offset-key="2931d7f359c1493684a41eb0baa657cb:0">The CMS can provide a side by side interface for authoring content in multiple languages. Configuring the CMS for i18n support requires top level configuration, collection level configuration and field level configuration.</span></span>

### 

<span key="289d3578249a46bab780b463eb1de65f"><span offset-key="289d3578249a46bab780b463eb1de65f:0">Top level configuration</span></span>

<span key="41c2b1d68aa34f0cbec81b3b08127903"><span offset-key="41c2b1d68aa34f0cbec81b3b08127903:0"> # Required and can be one of multiple\_folders, multiple\_files or single\_file</span></span>

3

<span key="43e65851b7714919bdb57e532b79604a"><span offset-key="43e65851b7714919bdb57e532b79604a:0"> # multiple\_folders - persists files in \`&lt;folder>/&lt;locale>/&lt;slug>.&lt;extension>\`</span></span>

4

<span key="e6bfe38ea4f34c7c82e8418ffc0e1baf"><span offset-key="e6bfe38ea4f34c7c82e8418ffc0e1baf:0"> # multiple\_files - persists files in \`&lt;folder>/&lt;slug>.&lt;locale>.&lt;extension>\`</span></span>

5

<span key="de30ce0fe5c94def8ed98e5bb4bdc631"><span offset-key="de30ce0fe5c94def8ed98e5bb4bdc631:0"> # single\_file - persists a single file in \`&lt;folder>/&lt;slug>.&lt;extension>\`</span></span>

### 

<span key="212f5af8e4af4712858bafc1bd5913ce"><span offset-key="212f5af8e4af4712858bafc1bd5913ce:0">Limitations</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="ef1c3d874c964e3e8713eb6636886ea8"><span offset-key="ef1c3d874c964e3e8713eb6636886ea8:0">File collections support only </span>`structure: single_file`<span offset-key="ef1c3d874c964e3e8713eb6636886ea8:2">.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="2208a1c93814456e80ba0ce516b757fe"><span offset-key="2208a1c93814456e80ba0ce516b757fe:0">List widgets only support </span>`i18n: true`<span offset-key="2208a1c93814456e80ba0ce516b757fe:2">. </span>`i18n`<span offset-key="2208a1c93814456e80ba0ce516b757fe:4"> configuration on sub fields is ignored.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="5237d50253aa4e37a99b518613fd5197"><span offset-key="5237d50253aa4e37a99b518613fd5197:0">Object widgets only support </span>`i18n: true`<span offset-key="5237d50253aa4e37a99b518613fd5197:2"> and </span>`i18n`<span offset-key="5237d50253aa4e37a99b518613fd5197:4"> configuration should be done per field:</span></span>

1

<span key="9af8133592854cb5a028b0a5f0a71870"><span offset-key="9af8133592854cb5a028b0a5f0a71870:0">- label: 'Object'</span></span>

2

<span key="a646de9a15ed424c87d5300db9719a02"><span offset-key="a646de9a15ed424c87d5300db9719a02:0"> name: 'object'</span></span>

3

<span key="0d0a70e195084b8cbd135d1b39de1bc7"><span offset-key="0d0a70e195084b8cbd135d1b39de1bc7:0"> widget: 'object'</span></span>

4

## 

<span key="4c4456df1b2442eba7eb3f7104fdf4ed"><span offset-key="4c4456df1b2442eba7eb3f7104fdf4ed:0">GitHub GraphQL API</span></span>

<span key="68ea1ed1fc3b4002bc55e366140febad"><span offset-key="68ea1ed1fc3b4002bc55e366140febad:0">Experimental support for GitHub's </span></span><a href="https://developer.github.com/v4/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6c855343d84640939c0f654f1e4b358f" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="d1667c9e1f66417e99170f2ed5b0a49d"><span data-offset-key="d1667c9e1f66417e99170f2ed5b0a49d:0">GraphQL API</span></span></span></a><span key="3494be4204554e9eafb561f95a3555f2"><span offset-key="3494be4204554e9eafb561f95a3555f2:0"> is now available for the GitHub backend.</span></span>

<span key="748073fb4d414ea188bfe21f5f78c49f">**Note: not currently compatible with Git Gateway.**</span>

<span key="43be730a88f049f79fbeb1b8d7d33896"><span offset-key="43be730a88f049f79fbeb1b8d7d33896:0">For many queries, GraphQL allows data to be retrieved using less individual API requests compared to a REST API. GitHub's GraphQL API still does not support all mutations necessary to completely replace their REST API, so this feature only calls the new GraphQL API where possible.</span></span>

<span key="2b9c8c32f024468ba28d433f79dd58a6"><span offset-key="2b9c8c32f024468ba28d433f79dd58a6:0">You can use the GraphQL API for the GitHub backend by setting </span>`backend.use_graphql`<span offset-key="2b9c8c32f024468ba28d433f79dd58a6:2"> to </span>`true`<span offset-key="2b9c8c32f024468ba28d433f79dd58a6:4"> in your CMS config:</span></span>

1

<span key="1114e9d975324202a2454992f3525387"><span offset-key="1114e9d975324202a2454992f3525387:0">backend:</span></span>

2

<span key="664e4d6115494c50a491274a4a18f40e"><span offset-key="664e4d6115494c50a491274a4a18f40e:0"> name: github</span></span>

3

<span key="7e7acabc300a4a7588deea808e8ee68f"><span offset-key="7e7acabc300a4a7588deea808e8ee68f:0"> repo: owner/repo # replace this with your repo info</span></span>

4

<span key="f2f67820e98a434383a19bb5650d7895"><span offset-key="f2f67820e98a434383a19bb5650d7895:0"> use\_graphql: true</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="7f3c65cd09c04ff3995b640da958e56d"><span offset-key="7f3c65cd09c04ff3995b640da958e56d:0">Learn more about the benefits of GraphQL in the </span></span><a href="https://graphql.org" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="287d53355657439ea0785e25a652ecd0" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="ca3b2b495cf641b2a4d08f1274b1b0f0"><span data-offset-key="ca3b2b495cf641b2a4d08f1274b1b0f0:0">GraphQL docs</span></span></span></a><span key="c8795c73a0ea40f8a3df6be21542ee86"><span offset-key="c8795c73a0ea40f8a3df6be21542ee86:0">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="667c0f66a717421a9f0209a7b6f8c0a3"><span offset-key="667c0f66a717421a9f0209a7b6f8c0a3:0">Open Authoring</span></span>

<span key="f0e654cf6119481cbb186658e327ed3e"><span offset-key="f0e654cf6119481cbb186658e327ed3e:0">When using the </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/github-backend" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="aa09cd71798e453eb4b3c38f26922315" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="f95c0f2ee29440beb10f97bba60d9a1d"><span data-offset-key="f95c0f2ee29440beb10f97bba60d9a1d:0">GitHub backend</span></span></span></a><span key="6cd0f3a2d276481a9c091ee0a3db9057"><span offset-key="6cd0f3a2d276481a9c091ee0a3db9057:0">, you can use Netlify CMS to accept contributions from GitHub users without giving them access to your repository. When they make changes in the CMS, the CMS forks your repository for them behind the scenes, and all the changes are made to the fork. When the contributor is ready to submit their changes, they can set their draft as ready for review in the CMS. This triggers a pull request to your repository, which you can merge using the GitHub UI.</span></span>

<span key="45c5aed8ee0f4cc9837406efab3a70cd"><span offset-key="45c5aed8ee0f4cc9837406efab3a70cd:0">At the same time, any contributors who </span>*do*<span offset-key="45c5aed8ee0f4cc9837406efab3a70cd:2"> have write access to the repository can continue to use Netlify CMS normally.</span></span>

<span key="6e3db128031c481781fa464832c69fbe"><span offset-key="6e3db128031c481781fa464832c69fbe:0">More details and setup instructions can be found on </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/open-authoring" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="46bc674da43e46f6b63e702f8a2cace1" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="aea11786a6304414afa4aaa8b64553dd"><span data-offset-key="aea11786a6304414afa4aaa8b64553dd:0">the Open Authoring docs page</span></span></span></a><span key="9bd6d298dbca4a63a401f0c130b8b55e"><span offset-key="9bd6d298dbca4a63a401f0c130b8b55e:0">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="dbd96fec99cf457db8c2ceaf8c188124"><span offset-key="dbd96fec99cf457db8c2ceaf8c188124:0">Folder Collections Path</span></span>

<span key="450a349c71a74be2b5feb8909f7d56b7"><span offset-key="450a349c71a74be2b5feb8909f7d56b7:0">By default the CMS stores folder collection content under the folder specified in the collection setting.</span></span>

<span key="9f6b482b316d4de4bc559d5286bc444d"><span offset-key="9f6b482b316d4de4bc559d5286bc444d:0">For example configuring </span>`folder: posts`<span offset-key="9f6b482b316d4de4bc559d5286bc444d:2"> for a collection will save the content under </span>`posts/post-title.md`<span offset-key="9f6b482b316d4de4bc559d5286bc444d:4">.</span></span>

<span key="426444aa75c24f7eb9334cb910c152b4"><span offset-key="426444aa75c24f7eb9334cb910c152b4:0">You can now specify an additional </span>`path`<span offset-key="426444aa75c24f7eb9334cb910c152b4:2"> template (similar to the </span>`slug`<span offset-key="426444aa75c24f7eb9334cb910c152b4:4"> template) to control the content destination.</span></span>

<span key="b15230b54dd74140be2d5950d07af91e"><span offset-key="b15230b54dd74140be2d5950d07af91e:0">This allows saving content in subfolders, e.g. configuring </span>`path: '{{year}}/{{slug}}'`<span offset-key="b15230b54dd74140be2d5950d07af91e:2"> will save the content under </span>`posts/2019/post-title.md`<span offset-key="b15230b54dd74140be2d5950d07af91e:4">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="8433b548d52041f98833a0227ab8b44f"><span offset-key="8433b548d52041f98833a0227ab8b44f:0">Folder Collections Media and Public Folder</span></span>

<span key="7b04289c21694e0abb204fba48a995e5"><span offset-key="7b04289c21694e0abb204fba48a995e5:0">By default the CMS stores media files for all collections under a global </span>`media_folder`<span offset-key="7b04289c21694e0abb204fba48a995e5:2"> directory as specified in the configuration.</span></span>

<span key="5114d756503f412798cfdd4ab769a002"><span offset-key="5114d756503f412798cfdd4ab769a002:0">When using the global </span>`media_folder`<span offset-key="5114d756503f412798cfdd4ab769a002:2"> directory any entry field that points to a media file will use the absolute path to the published file as designated by the </span>`public_folder`<span offset-key="5114d756503f412798cfdd4ab769a002:4"> configuration.</span></span>

<span key="66aa4b64c4e84e12bc9c26b11027362a"><span offset-key="66aa4b64c4e84e12bc9c26b11027362a:0">For example configuring:</span></span>

1

<span key="aa42b45658ec4abeb3684bfb2a9d7452"><span offset-key="aa42b45658ec4abeb3684bfb2a9d7452:0">media\_folder: static/media</span></span>

2

<span key="392ecf088ba541a4bc03c8a7b1a1eb96"><span offset-key="392ecf088ba541a4bc03c8a7b1a1eb96:0">public\_folder: /media</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="a46bb7e6c0e14da6b4ca59a063c30591"><span offset-key="a46bb7e6c0e14da6b4ca59a063c30591:0">And saving an entry with an image named </span>`image.png`<span offset-key="a46bb7e6c0e14da6b4ca59a063c30591:2"> will result in the image being saved under </span>`static/media/image.png`<span offset-key="a46bb7e6c0e14da6b4ca59a063c30591:4"> and relevant entry fields populated with the value of </span>`/media/image.png`<span offset-key="a46bb7e6c0e14da6b4ca59a063c30591:6">.</span></span>

<span key="17adecad19e34909bbd230604424c91a"><span offset-key="17adecad19e34909bbd230604424c91a:0">Some static site generators (e.g. Gatsby) work best when using relative image paths.</span></span>

<span key="3618b806b72546c38337b4846093188c"><span offset-key="3618b806b72546c38337b4846093188c:0">This can now be achieved using a per collection </span>`media_folder`<span offset-key="3618b806b72546c38337b4846093188c:2"> configuration which specifies a relative media folder for the collection.</span></span>

<span key="dc0ea83fc70f4684a6267c9b888f8fb0"><span offset-key="dc0ea83fc70f4684a6267c9b888f8fb0:0">For example, the following configuration will result in media files being saved in the same directory as the entry, and the image field being populated with the relative path to the image.</span></span>

1

<span key="e4588fa8b1f346b2939434cfab17ea07"><span offset-key="e4588fa8b1f346b2939434cfab17ea07:0">media\_folder: static/media</span></span>

2

<span key="7fdb81505c454416b79979ec27512e33"><span offset-key="7fdb81505c454416b79979ec27512e33:0">public\_folder: /media</span></span>

3

<span key="ceaddfc3d8924934b479967fb52f07f5"><span offset-key="ceaddfc3d8924934b479967fb52f07f5:0">collections:</span></span>

4

<span key="91b68a46ef5d4362895be585ab827d86"><span offset-key="91b68a46ef5d4362895be585ab827d86:0"> - name: posts</span></span>

5

<span key="732373587714415d9f9b089e097e25b2"><span offset-key="732373587714415d9f9b089e097e25b2:0"> label: Posts</span></span>

6

<span key="0cf38ca48bfc4aaf917ad09c94988920"><span offset-key="0cf38ca48bfc4aaf917ad09c94988920:0"> label\_singular: 'Post'</span></span>

7

<span key="5b27224c40bd4a138734e9b192f4bc66"><span offset-key="5b27224c40bd4a138734e9b192f4bc66:0"> folder: content/posts</span></span>

8

<span key="47ffdc94aa5a4fb1a9badd868fdff4c6"><span offset-key="47ffdc94aa5a4fb1a9badd868fdff4c6:0"> path: '{{slug}}/index'</span></span>

9

<span key="d2f279deb919407793def319f58f85aa"><span offset-key="d2f279deb919407793def319f58f85aa:0"> media\_folder: ''</span></span>

10

<span key="5d8449cca23e4d22884f64616e6fccfe"><span offset-key="5d8449cca23e4d22884f64616e6fccfe:0"> public\_folder: ''</span></span>

11

<span key="88810a73e3a94e73850c787c55a51903"><span offset-key="88810a73e3a94e73850c787c55a51903:0"> fields:</span></span>

12

<span key="6435bec343c14d629d74d7fc3283b8fa"><span offset-key="6435bec343c14d629d74d7fc3283b8fa:0"> - label: Title</span></span>

13

<span key="bb09977df3c7494e9bc02ea4f6c48dc5"><span offset-key="bb09977df3c7494e9bc02ea4f6c48dc5:0"> name: title</span></span>

14

<span key="ff3ac6e215d64988a5bd2bced9317e43"><span offset-key="ff3ac6e215d64988a5bd2bced9317e43:0"> widget: string</span></span>

15

<span key="4ec45e5c5d6d4a8f8005b73962c1638b"><span offset-key="4ec45e5c5d6d4a8f8005b73962c1638b:0"> - label: 'Cover Image'</span></span>

16

<span key="d99ec6695d9645cbb35ab23ac87b5df1"><span offset-key="d99ec6695d9645cbb35ab23ac87b5df1:0"> name: 'image'</span></span>

17

<span key="1d850ec6532e498e8f16a980aaf1902e"><span offset-key="1d850ec6532e498e8f16a980aaf1902e:0"> widget: 'image'</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="1fee93e218f94c17ad061b98027b4f5e"><span offset-key="1fee93e218f94c17ad061b98027b4f5e:0">More specifically, saving an entry with a title of </span>`example post`<span offset-key="1fee93e218f94c17ad061b98027b4f5e:2"> with an image named </span>`image.png`<span offset-key="1fee93e218f94c17ad061b98027b4f5e:4"> will result in a directory structure of:</span></span>

1

<span key="e9691ccb3037429eb96f15ce133cb8f2"><span offset-key="e9691ccb3037429eb96f15ce133cb8f2:0">content</span></span>

2

<span key="16787fd7c227494d9ae0dcfbbe819929"><span offset-key="16787fd7c227494d9ae0dcfbbe819929:0"> posts</span></span>

3

<span key="b8c580b776ba41e288d661321dcf389d"><span offset-key="b8c580b776ba41e288d661321dcf389d:0"> example-post</span></span>

4

<span key="8d85f9d4f38e4135a35be19ad0f75be8"><span offset-key="8d85f9d4f38e4135a35be19ad0f75be8:0"> index.md</span></span>

5

<span key="2dad9805aaa749beb3b34c3e33610bf2"><span offset-key="2dad9805aaa749beb3b34c3e33610bf2:0"> image.png</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="8a9f7e22c84544508c64300ec26a3c43"><span offset-key="8a9f7e22c84544508c64300ec26a3c43:0">And for the image field being populated with a value of </span>`image.png`<span offset-key="8a9f7e22c84544508c64300ec26a3c43:2">.</span></span>

<span key="b1bd1aac028948a6a67361cc388835b2">**Note: When specifying a** **`path`** **on a folder collection,** **`media_folder`** **defaults to an empty string.**</span>

<span key="d8f78d485d674c5aa704d2605a32ceaf">**Available template tags:**</span>

<span key="035d7ad8dfba4d84b9167c0cf854e3fc"><span offset-key="035d7ad8dfba4d84b9167c0cf854e3fc:0">Supports all of the </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/configuration-options#slug" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="55f46d52b1014046b0fced131fa6aacf" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="d0f1aaaeefe14a21a81773bf9ceb9a67"><code class="r-1vckr1u r-z2wwpe r-uibjmv r-m2pi6t r-1hvjb8t" data-slate-leaf="true" data-offset-key="d0f1aaaeefe14a21a81773bf9ceb9a67:0">slug</code><span data-offset-key="d0f1aaaeefe14a21a81773bf9ceb9a67:1"> templates</span></span></span></a><span key="d940d5a3aa6c427eb4e260b7691545e5"><span offset-key="d940d5a3aa6c427eb4e260b7691545e5:0"> and:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="b381da53323c471b90779c92886d0bd8">`{{dirname}}`<span offset-key="b381da53323c471b90779c92886d0bd8:1"> The path to the file's parent directory, relative to the collection's </span>`folder`<span offset-key="b381da53323c471b90779c92886d0bd8:3">.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="1add0a323ff64a989ad6b1ec5a1dec65">`{{filename}}`<span offset-key="1add0a323ff64a989ad6b1ec5a1dec65:1"> The file name without the extension part.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="c5ac8e7aaaee40b7a1fd1ec3c0bda3fc">`{{extension}}`<span offset-key="c5ac8e7aaaee40b7a1fd1ec3c0bda3fc:1"> The file extension.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="a41c966c4518437885e7c77e7d07c745">`{{media_folder}}`<span offset-key="a41c966c4518437885e7c77e7d07c745:1"> The global </span>`media_folder`<span offset-key="a41c966c4518437885e7c77e7d07c745:3">.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="6c3eae9eaac741d0b8cf3cc5851d067b">`{{public_folder}}`<span offset-key="6c3eae9eaac741d0b8cf3cc5851d067b:1"> The global </span>`public_folder`<span offset-key="6c3eae9eaac741d0b8cf3cc5851d067b:3">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="a3d7a0893b79487885a56f8e8fc71f05"><span offset-key="a3d7a0893b79487885a56f8e8fc71f05:0">List Widget: Variable Types</span></span>

<span key="13491eebf9e743579215fb9302313f64"><span offset-key="13491eebf9e743579215fb9302313f64:0">Before this feature, the </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/widgets/#list" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="0cf2b00f7093403e91675edf8f2f8ede" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="bcc3b9612f4449cb99fd498b047d0414"><span data-offset-key="bcc3b9612f4449cb99fd498b047d0414:0">list widget</span></span></span></a><span key="48714ef234ad4d8d9a501a28fbff0d49"><span offset-key="48714ef234ad4d8d9a501a28fbff0d49:0"> allowed a set of fields to be repeated, but every list item had the same set of fields available. With variable types, multiple named sets of fields can be defined, which opens the door to highly flexible content authoring (even page building) in Netlify CMS.</span></span>

<span key="c5834f8b3e1a496f9ff525f155304b6f">**Note: this feature does not yet support default previews and requires** </span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/customization#registerpreviewtemplate" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="c6a80031bc6c4eb6a4631481b1c37046" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="b532270a8a524278b160a59c3389b006"><strong>registering a preview template</strong></span></span></a><span key="12c680b818f64431b729ce4f1608fcaf"> **in order to show up in the preview pane.**</span>

<span key="36dbda10abdf425aba56e3597659665c"><span offset-key="36dbda10abdf425aba56e3597659665c:0">To use variable types in the list widget, update your field configuration as follows:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="75b78beadb6f4f83b2171339bb334cb8"><span offset-key="75b78beadb6f4f83b2171339bb334cb8:0">Instead of defining your list fields under </span>`fields`<span offset-key="75b78beadb6f4f83b2171339bb334cb8:2"> or </span>`field`<span offset-key="75b78beadb6f4f83b2171339bb334cb8:4">, define them under </span>`types`<span offset-key="75b78beadb6f4f83b2171339bb334cb8:6">. Similar to </span>`fields`<span offset-key="75b78beadb6f4f83b2171339bb334cb8:8">, </span>`types`<span offset-key="75b78beadb6f4f83b2171339bb334cb8:10"> must be an array of field definition objects.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="84a6016bfa4f4373af5a16de08f759b9"><span offset-key="84a6016bfa4f4373af5a16de08f759b9:0">Each field definition under </span>`types`<span offset-key="84a6016bfa4f4373af5a16de08f759b9:2"> must use the </span>`object`<span offset-key="84a6016bfa4f4373af5a16de08f759b9:4"> widget (this is the default value for </span>`widget`<span offset-key="84a6016bfa4f4373af5a16de08f759b9:6">).</span></span>

### 

<span key="876845c3adf14c90835bad58f79f030a"><span offset-key="876845c3adf14c90835bad58f79f030a:0">Additional list widget options</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="20a865652c33422f8bcc4a44bfcbbbbf">`types`<span offset-key="20a865652c33422f8bcc4a44bfcbbbbf:1">: a nested list of object widgets. All widgets must be of type </span>`object`<span offset-key="20a865652c33422f8bcc4a44bfcbbbbf:3">. Every object widget may define different set of fields.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="171e8d522fb1498f83e40430a4a39e12">`typeKey`<span offset-key="171e8d522fb1498f83e40430a4a39e12:1">: the name of the field that will be added to every item in list representing the name of the object widget that item belongs to. Ignored if </span>`types`<span offset-key="171e8d522fb1498f83e40430a4a39e12:3"> is not defined. Default is </span>`type`<span offset-key="171e8d522fb1498f83e40430a4a39e12:5">.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="7eb0cfa7007a471aa78d7d5d514d9445">`summary`<span offset-key="7eb0cfa7007a471aa78d7d5d514d9445:1">: allows customization of a collapsed list item object in a similar way to a </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/configuration-options/?#summary" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="e35be465bb29404e86c0fca8a16a270f" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="e8d4470800134a069e541a0da7d68c1f"><span data-offset-key="e8d4470800134a069e541a0da7d68c1f:0">collection summary</span></span></span></a><span key="a4022c371e3f4e7da4d57a3bed758288"><span offset-key="a4022c371e3f4e7da4d57a3bed758288:0"><span slate-zero-width="z">​</span></span></span>

### 

<span key="f6bca45eb328407f96daf9b47cafb2d5"><span offset-key="f6bca45eb328407f96daf9b47cafb2d5:0">Example Configuration</span></span>

<span key="0ffd6bfeb83e4494ad37edc20aa67245"><span offset-key="0ffd6bfeb83e4494ad37edc20aa67245:0">The example configuration below imagines a scenario where the editor can add two "types" of content, either a "carousel" or a "spotlight". Each type has a unique name and set of fields.</span></span>

1

<span key="38e5e85ebcd14493819a7c31d81ef821"><span offset-key="38e5e85ebcd14493819a7c31d81ef821:0">- label: 'Home Section'</span></span>

2

<span key="aa985f6f88964cdfa361685f02ed4263"><span offset-key="aa985f6f88964cdfa361685f02ed4263:0"> name: 'sections'</span></span>

<span key="b01fc756326a477f9949c01c8e81920e"><span offset-key="b01fc756326a477f9949c01c8e81920e:0"> widget: 'list'</span></span>

4

<span key="682b8ea593764cc5b886c0ef3a76a379"><span offset-key="682b8ea593764cc5b886c0ef3a76a379:0"> types:</span></span>

<span key="041f73df11b8403cafb8375836319e12"><span offset-key="041f73df11b8403cafb8375836319e12:0"> - label: 'Carousel'</span></span>

6

<span key="0225ae2292b74f0aa47102e78ec648ec"><span offset-key="0225ae2292b74f0aa47102e78ec648ec:0"> name: 'carousel'</span></span>

7

<span key="37dcc8692dda4adab94506f808fc74d4"><span offset-key="37dcc8692dda4adab94506f808fc74d4:0"> widget: object</span></span>

8

<span key="e721c91a34314598bc878dd7c44aa1f9"><span offset-key="e721c91a34314598bc878dd7c44aa1f9:0"> summary: '{{fields.header}}'</span></span>

9

<span key="a332de558a9e4616940de5cf0d158c0c"><span offset-key="a332de558a9e4616940de5cf0d158c0c:0"> fields:</span></span>

10

<span key="ce6ff1d7508e47fa95ca3687e0d3fa17"><span offset-key="ce6ff1d7508e47fa95ca3687e0d3fa17:0"> - { label: Header, name: header, widget: string, default: 'Image Gallery' }</span></span>

11

<span key="42d9e5beeed84381816a2f06cba44bd8"><span offset-key="42d9e5beeed84381816a2f06cba44bd8:0"> - { label: Template, name: template, widget: string, default: 'carousel.html' }</span></span>

<span key="09267823280448a2aa93d0f8e6d14de6"><span offset-key="09267823280448a2aa93d0f8e6d14de6:0"> - label: Images</span></span>

13

<span key="17c8b92289164125973e303e0554bae5"><span offset-key="17c8b92289164125973e303e0554bae5:0"> name: images</span></span>

14

<span key="9025b5e9a64849cb8f61da393cbb6f19"><span offset-key="9025b5e9a64849cb8f61da393cbb6f19:0"> widget: list</span></span>

15

<span key="a5708ab1671746508b5e1aa19a35f477"><span offset-key="a5708ab1671746508b5e1aa19a35f477:0"> field: { label: Image, name: image, widget: image }</span></span>

16

<span key="3f7c509fc93248ee83af2e12ecd70b85"><span offset-key="3f7c509fc93248ee83af2e12ecd70b85:0"> - label: 'Spotlight'</span></span>

<span key="6315f7d5cf6d4c74a3a411ae6a9e3d10"><span offset-key="6315f7d5cf6d4c74a3a411ae6a9e3d10:0"> widget: object</span></span>

19

<span key="fbfef7d8ef7b4da6b40196a8eaf0f680"><span offset-key="fbfef7d8ef7b4da6b40196a8eaf0f680:0"> fields:</span></span>

<span key="fc8f3166ef0c40d88fb9b7e5f1e9b28d"><span offset-key="fc8f3166ef0c40d88fb9b7e5f1e9b28d:0"> - { label: Header, name: header, widget: string, default: 'Spotlight' }</span></span>

### 

<span key="c5c80b43b2b34d25b870fdd1406a5061"><span offset-key="c5c80b43b2b34d25b870fdd1406a5061:0">Example Output</span></span>

<span key="dea501a25e97478dac6f2d53fe7e1fcf"><span offset-key="dea501a25e97478dac6f2d53fe7e1fcf:0">The output for the list widget will be an array of objects, and each object will have a </span>`type`<span offset-key="dea501a25e97478dac6f2d53fe7e1fcf:2"> key with the name of the type used for the list item. The </span>`type`<span offset-key="dea501a25e97478dac6f2d53fe7e1fcf:4"> key name can be customized via the </span>`typeKey`<span offset-key="dea501a25e97478dac6f2d53fe7e1fcf:6"> property in the list configuration.</span></span>

<span key="eae2ae234e4245d08d7d4f340333e610"><span offset-key="eae2ae234e4245d08d7d4f340333e610:0">If the above example configuration were used to create a carousel, a spotlight, and another carousel, the output could look like this:</span></span>

1

<span key="5904c952169f4537b06278697da18f41"><span offset-key="5904c952169f4537b06278697da18f41:0">title: Home</span></span>

## 

<span key="445d2fdd33a14fa0a5386d16a9123b26"><span offset-key="445d2fdd33a14fa0a5386d16a9123b26:0">Custom Mount Element</span></span>

<span key="0a078a8cf02e41f48073cf6e8a48f850"><span offset-key="0a078a8cf02e41f48073cf6e8a48f850:0">Netlify CMS always creates its own DOM element for mounting the application, which means it always takes over the entire page, and is generally inflexible if you're trying to do something creative, like injecting it into a shared context.</span></span>

<span key="5b461f295fc84c0a8634413839589d81"><span offset-key="5b461f295fc84c0a8634413839589d81:0">You can now provide your own element for Netlify CMS to mount in by setting the target element's ID as </span>`nc-root`<span offset-key="5b461f295fc84c0a8634413839589d81:2">. If Netlify CMS finds an element with this ID during initialization, it will mount within that element instead of creating its own.</span></span>

## 

<span key="088ca9f072e74ddfae65f5f9110bdbb9"><span offset-key="088ca9f072e74ddfae65f5f9110bdbb9:0">Manual Initialization</span></span>

<span key="db38939802094803986774f08168b4a6"><span offset-key="db38939802094803986774f08168b4a6:0">Netlify CMS can now be manually initialized, rather than automatically loading up the moment you import it. The whole point of this at the moment is to inject configuration into Netlify CMS before it loads, bypassing need for an actual Netlify CMS </span>`config.yml`<span offset-key="db38939802094803986774f08168b4a6:2">. This is important, for example, when creating tight integrations with static site generators.</span></span>

<span key="1195113c9fff4a6aac41a2e820a87b61"><span offset-key="1195113c9fff4a6aac41a2e820a87b61:0">Assuming you have the netlify-cms package installed to your project, manual initialization works by setting </span>`window.CMS_MANUAL_INIT = true`<span offset-key="1195113c9fff4a6aac41a2e820a87b61:2"> </span>**before importing the CMS**<span offset-key="1195113c9fff4a6aac41a2e820a87b61:4">:</span></span>

1

<span key="0eab0491558e4b9aa07b3a702823aed1"><span offset-key="0eab0491558e4b9aa07b3a702823aed1:0">// This global flag enables manual initialization.</span></span>

2

<span key="4bf6e82f4ab44fa1b874a7891ab84389"><span offset-key="4bf6e82f4ab44fa1b874a7891ab84389:0">window.CMS\_MANUAL\_INIT = true</span></span>

3

<span key="63299b9bdcad4b23a4ea97755eebc36e"><span offset-key="63299b9bdcad4b23a4ea97755eebc36e:0">// Usage with import from npm package</span></span>

4

<span key="e1f4eec1b5eb4cc894545061d4ff7a32"><span offset-key="e1f4eec1b5eb4cc894545061d4ff7a32:0">import CMS, { init } from 'netlify-cms'</span></span>

5

<span key="661e3e0600074b71b2d48e10692e6d59"><span offset-key="661e3e0600074b71b2d48e10692e6d59:0">// Usage with script tag</span></span>

6

<span key="1141194233bb4bdc8eb4d0aef76795f6"><span offset-key="1141194233bb4bdc8eb4d0aef76795f6:0">const { CMS, initCMS: init } = window</span></span>

7

<span key="5cc96e59c3fe41cfb2c6560c121be547"><span offset-key="5cc96e59c3fe41cfb2c6560c121be547:0">/\*\*</span></span>

8

<span key="6acc6b5733124d9ca8e2714129af29c1"><span offset-key="6acc6b5733124d9ca8e2714129af29c1:0"> \* Initialize without passing in config - equivalent to just importing</span></span>

9

<span key="d7f616c521f94fe6aa9f43f0a0e7ad49"><span offset-key="d7f616c521f94fe6aa9f43f0a0e7ad49:0"> \* Netlify CMS the old way.</span></span>

10

<span key="45c8e1de89194c78b6020c0512884278"><span offset-key="45c8e1de89194c78b6020c0512884278:0"> \*/</span></span>

11

<span key="44bfb43dfb0b4d63a8ada86c7165439d"><span offset-key="44bfb43dfb0b4d63a8ada86c7165439d:0">init()</span></span>

## 

<span key="10ffe83007ac4bc1acc147c634f556a8"><span offset-key="10ffe83007ac4bc1acc147c634f556a8:0">Raw CSS in </span>`registerPreviewStyle`</span>

<span key="942336a086744de2952c855d0cb028e6">`registerPreviewStyle`<span offset-key="942336a086744de2952c855d0cb028e6:1"> can now accept a CSS string, in addition to accepting a url. The feature is activated by passing in an object as the second argument, with </span>`raw`<span offset-key="942336a086744de2952c855d0cb028e6:3"> set to a truthy value. This is critical for integrating with modern build tooling. Here's an example using webpack:</span></span>

1

<span key="f4971e7918cd4ab5876f3a3f7797b6af"><span offset-key="f4971e7918cd4ab5876f3a3f7797b6af:0">/\*\*</span></span>

2

<span key="ab322341f7bc42ad94ec7d0d78cf3962"><span offset-key="ab322341f7bc42ad94ec7d0d78cf3962:0"> \* Assumes a webpack project with \`sass-loader\` and \`css-loader\` installed.</span></span>

3

<span key="6ceab662d5594c748b74e1634b2c160d"><span offset-key="6ceab662d5594c748b74e1634b2c160d:0"> \* Takes advantage of the \`toString\` method in the return value of \`css-loader\`.</span></span>

4

<span key="7f87edaff78b41e48f87197152e0eaa3"><span offset-key="7f87edaff78b41e48f87197152e0eaa3:0"> \*/</span></span>

5

<span key="eb2594c7a40c4d7e80445e810e6a6766"><span offset-key="eb2594c7a40c4d7e80445e810e6a6766:0">import CMS from 'netlify-cms';</span></span>

6

<span key="124e155756a343a6b38ac7a66c76f654"><span offset-key="124e155756a343a6b38ac7a66c76f654:0">import styles from '!css-loader!sass-loader!../main.scss';</span></span>

7

<span key="c3fd01e1e3834d76ba8ebd98638ebbeb"><span offset-key="c3fd01e1e3834d76ba8ebd98638ebbeb:0">CMS.registerPreviewStyle(styles.toString(), { raw: true });</span></span>

## 

<span key="e8be31f6478d4fc585c1b59ae08d5e2b"><span offset-key="e8be31f6478d4fc585c1b59ae08d5e2b:0">Squash merge GitHub pull requests</span></span>

<span key="ca06a274a51f480a807fda3f9f8670d3"><span offset-key="ca06a274a51f480a807fda3f9f8670d3:0">When using the </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/configuration-options/#publish-mode" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="ed0b2fb1555e42b48497f519d5cb6f0e" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="33295e71de7e4ecc93f3c882430b5fdd"><span data-offset-key="33295e71de7e4ecc93f3c882430b5fdd:0">Editorial Workflow</span></span></span></a><span key="796730e6efc64d17a35ade2539039444"><span offset-key="796730e6efc64d17a35ade2539039444:0"> with the </span>`github`<span offset-key="796730e6efc64d17a35ade2539039444:2"> or GitHub-connected </span>`git-gateway`<span offset-key="796730e6efc64d17a35ade2539039444:4"> backends, Netlify CMS creates a pull request for each unpublished entry. Every time the unpublished entry is changed and saved, a new commit is added to the pull request. When the entry is published, the pull request is merged, and all of those commits are added to your project commit history in a merge commit.</span></span>

<span key="9f8d8792c66246cd85b296f4c725a7b0"><span offset-key="9f8d8792c66246cd85b296f4c725a7b0:0">The squash merge option causes all commits to be "squashed" into a single commit when the pull request is merged, and the resulting commit is rebased onto the target branch, avoiding the merge commit altogether.</span></span>

<span key="193dc19af741484fa962fa046448999f"><span offset-key="193dc19af741484fa962fa046448999f:0">To enable this feature, you can set the following option in your Netlify CMS </span>`config.yml`<span offset-key="193dc19af741484fa962fa046448999f:2">:</span></span>

1

<span key="70c33cdea325425b9d5328dc57f22f31"><span offset-key="70c33cdea325425b9d5328dc57f22f31:0">backend:</span></span>

2

<span key="f28eed210fec412fb6ef13b716cc191e"><span offset-key="f28eed210fec412fb6ef13b716cc191e:0"> squash\_merges: true</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

## 

<span key="919baa64f2e04a489ada3bd6662161e0"><span offset-key="919baa64f2e04a489ada3bd6662161e0:0">Commit Message Templates</span></span>

<span key="d9e39eb099fa41df9757febb86bd663d"><span offset-key="d9e39eb099fa41df9757febb86bd663d:0">You can customize the templates used by Netlify CMS to generate commit messages by setting the </span>`commit_messages`<span offset-key="d9e39eb099fa41df9757febb86bd663d:2"> option under </span>`backend`<span offset-key="d9e39eb099fa41df9757febb86bd663d:4"> in your Netlify CMS </span>`config.yml`<span offset-key="d9e39eb099fa41df9757febb86bd663d:6">.</span></span>

<span key="11abdf11414f499a96a5ea1313114e1c"><span offset-key="11abdf11414f499a96a5ea1313114e1c:0">Template tags wrapped in curly braces will be expanded to include information about the file changed by the commit. For example, </span>`{{path}}`<span offset-key="11abdf11414f499a96a5ea1313114e1c:2"> will include the full path to the file changed.</span></span>

<span key="5db9607d7e794450b2afcec4fcdfc004"><span offset-key="5db9607d7e794450b2afcec4fcdfc004:0">Setting up your Netlify CMS </span>`config.yml`<span offset-key="5db9607d7e794450b2afcec4fcdfc004:2"> to recreate the default values would look like this:</span></span>

1

<span key="7bb3c46cf63641bf88aa251bdb5ca8db"><span offset-key="7bb3c46cf63641bf88aa251bdb5ca8db:0">backend:</span></span>

2

<span key="a7a9b41c2b634e8392c203e0b2fd5752"><span offset-key="a7a9b41c2b634e8392c203e0b2fd5752:0"> commit\_messages:</span></span>

3

<span key="c5a71ba72c9e41d6b1d87aa18c03576b"><span offset-key="c5a71ba72c9e41d6b1d87aa18c03576b:0"> create: Create {{collection}} “{{slug}}”</span></span>

4

<span key="e85d8a8c548d492ea188ec4457b74135"><span offset-key="e85d8a8c548d492ea188ec4457b74135:0"> update: Update {{collection}} “{{slug}}”</span></span>

5

<span key="b292e137500840a1b42aff1301720a6e"><span offset-key="b292e137500840a1b42aff1301720a6e:0"> delete: Delete {{collection}} “{{slug}}”</span></span>

6

<span key="30d356cf0d5b44f1b50e1127df476236"><span offset-key="30d356cf0d5b44f1b50e1127df476236:0"> uploadMedia: Upload “{{path}}”</span></span>

7

<span key="d9b15c20e8fe4fbe83f8cb01429ef4a0"><span offset-key="d9b15c20e8fe4fbe83f8cb01429ef4a0:0"> deleteMedia: Delete “{{path}}”</span></span>

8

<span key="fc85894a77c64e3d8c0afbf5ed47b169"><span offset-key="fc85894a77c64e3d8c0afbf5ed47b169:0"> openAuthoring: '{{message}}'</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="fe2454436e064298a71a139f0055c4db"><span offset-key="fe2454436e064298a71a139f0055c4db:0">Netlify CMS generates the following commit types:</span></span>

Commit type

When is it triggered?

Available template tags

<span key="f825a7d97c53481b96567e8120ab5a18">`create`</span>

<span key="1dc1c5ee73e24096aca7bf796bc7618f"><span offset-key="1dc1c5ee73e24096aca7bf796bc7618f:0">A new entry is created</span></span>

<span key="2d1835cf75934c6da6cacbd640f10fe7">`slug`<span offset-key="2d1835cf75934c6da6cacbd640f10fe7:1">, </span>`path`<span offset-key="2d1835cf75934c6da6cacbd640f10fe7:3">, </span>`collection`<span offset-key="2d1835cf75934c6da6cacbd640f10fe7:5">, </span>`author-login`<span offset-key="2d1835cf75934c6da6cacbd640f10fe7:7">, </span>`author-name`</span>

<span key="a4d3ee61d1844ccc9bc5c21483eb9faa">`update`</span>

<span key="9f8748242c6c40419accd2418d08a995"><span offset-key="9f8748242c6c40419accd2418d08a995:0">An existing entry is changed</span></span>

<span key="e9a01db48f5049778ca755019f1d50a1">`slug`<span offset-key="e9a01db48f5049778ca755019f1d50a1:1">, </span>`path`<span offset-key="e9a01db48f5049778ca755019f1d50a1:3">, </span>`collection`<span offset-key="e9a01db48f5049778ca755019f1d50a1:5">, </span>`author-login`<span offset-key="e9a01db48f5049778ca755019f1d50a1:7">, </span>`author-name`</span>

<span key="b616e8ba057b442a8a7337f8a716d302">`delete`</span>

<span key="948f93b740ec48fc99d4cd4eb77facad"><span offset-key="948f93b740ec48fc99d4cd4eb77facad:0">An existing entry is deleted</span></span>

<span key="9fb9164ae11248be809af191e03fb667">`slug`<span offset-key="9fb9164ae11248be809af191e03fb667:1">, </span>`path`<span offset-key="9fb9164ae11248be809af191e03fb667:3">, </span>`collection`<span offset-key="9fb9164ae11248be809af191e03fb667:5">, </span>`author-login`<span offset-key="9fb9164ae11248be809af191e03fb667:7">, </span>`author-name`</span>

<span key="9a6f1c9bd6334d1dbcff85d551a32579">`uploadMedia`</span>

<span key="2f5531e8d0d44cdc9af465019f290a36"><span offset-key="2f5531e8d0d44cdc9af465019f290a36:0">A media file is uploaded</span></span>

<span key="05638e02b7354855a7e53a6a56899973">`path`<span offset-key="05638e02b7354855a7e53a6a56899973:1">, </span>`author-login`<span offset-key="05638e02b7354855a7e53a6a56899973:3">, </span>`author-name`</span>

<span key="61f353f9891d4ad8a47d0e2b3431168b">`deleteMedia`</span>

<span key="41bda5d544d745ae9a449b7d8a19bc98"><span offset-key="41bda5d544d745ae9a449b7d8a19bc98:0">A media file is deleted</span></span>

<span key="0d7acf078a934edfa7daeb8a23036c6e">`path`<span offset-key="0d7acf078a934edfa7daeb8a23036c6e:1">, </span>`author-login`<span offset-key="0d7acf078a934edfa7daeb8a23036c6e:3">, </span>`author-name`</span>

<span key="6c54a0c2b3504103baf51153f4c9c853">`openAuthoring`</span>

<span key="d728ecd5100e478d8548a05e623163d3"><span offset-key="d728ecd5100e478d8548a05e623163d3:0">A commit is made via a forked repository</span></span>

<span key="96a5d14928e64bd0823b2f31ef7b830f">`message`<span offset-key="96a5d14928e64bd0823b2f31ef7b830f:1">, </span>`author-login`<span offset-key="96a5d14928e64bd0823b2f31ef7b830f:3">, </span>`author-name`</span>

<span key="a5b476ee71aa4893b86fd96a91d94a99"><span offset-key="a5b476ee71aa4893b86fd96a91d94a99:0">Template tags produce the following output:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="535c592d4a804aee9241116710cd33a0">`{{slug}}`<span offset-key="535c592d4a804aee9241116710cd33a0:1">: the url-safe filename of the entry changed</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="460b868ee52e4d01a5cbff956c68e93b">`{{collection}}`<span offset-key="460b868ee52e4d01a5cbff956c68e93b:1">: the name of the collection containing the entry changed</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="7ab99aa57377497481a3fb9aa443319d">`{{path}}`<span offset-key="7ab99aa57377497481a3fb9aa443319d:1">: the full path to the file changed</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="6bfdbe56bfa543da9646dba713c0038f">`{{message}}`<span offset-key="6bfdbe56bfa543da9646dba713c0038f:1">: the relevant message based on the current change (e.g. the </span>`create`<span offset-key="6bfdbe56bfa543da9646dba713c0038f:3"> message when an entry is created)</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="266167027bd24fe1bd23af2cdf3e1170">`{{author-login}}`<span offset-key="266167027bd24fe1bd23af2cdf3e1170:1">: the login/username of the author</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="887e16bf93b84b94829ea0aa2462fe42">`{{author-name}}`<span offset-key="887e16bf93b84b94829ea0aa2462fe42:1">: the full name of the author (might be empty based on the user's profile)</span></span>

<span key="1d0c1a65882b4de88f67f6c370c30b8a"><span offset-key="1d0c1a65882b4de88f67f6c370c30b8a:0"> summary: "{{title | upper}} - {{date | date('YYYY-MM-DD')}}"</span></span>

## 

<span key="efaff26127214a5f9d4a61c040ed7e99"><span offset-key="efaff26127214a5f9d4a61c040ed7e99:0">Registering to CMS Events</span></span>

<span key="c4d32ad73c3541449cf5403628e7300d"><span offset-key="c4d32ad73c3541449cf5403628e7300d:0">You can execute a function when a specific CMS event occurs.</span></span>

2

<span key="e39e310979ca4f1692839fcbd9f713a6"><span offset-key="e39e310979ca4f1692839fcbd9f713a6:0"> name: 'prePublish',</span></span>

3

<span key="d25eba01a8364c0a8e8b091fc61fd598"><span offset-key="d25eba01a8364c0a8e8b091fc61fd598:0"> handler: ({ author, entry }) => console.log(JSON.stringify({ author, data: entry.get('data') })),</span></span>

4

<span key="25244feb3fd54da08c920c38f1185e23"><span offset-key="25244feb3fd54da08c920c38f1185e23:0">});</span></span>

<span key="2a37faa6e37f40a7b5fd3df5afc95a57"><span offset-key="2a37faa6e37f40a7b5fd3df5afc95a57:0">clicking the following link: </span>`/#/collections/posts/new?title=first&object.title=second&body=%23%20content`</span>

<span key="58370d08a3f64539a897a2f2fb5fd277"><span offset-key="58370d08a3f64539a897a2f2fb5fd277:0">will open the editor for a new post with the </span>`title`<span offset-key="58370d08a3f64539a897a2f2fb5fd277:2"> field populated with </span>`first`<span offset-key="58370d08a3f64539a897a2f2fb5fd277:4">, the nested </span>`object.title`<span offset-key="58370d08a3f64539a897a2f2fb5fd277:6"> field with </span>`second`<span offset-key="58370d08a3f64539a897a2f2fb5fd277:8"> and the markdown </span>`body`<span offset-key="58370d08a3f64539a897a2f2fb5fd277:10"> field with </span>`# content`<span offset-key="58370d08a3f64539a897a2f2fb5fd277:12">.</span></span>

<span key="cd28698efa8c46d48af87fe09aa353b3">**Note:**<span offset-key="cd28698efa8c46d48af87fe09aa353b3:1"> URL Encoding might be required for certain values (e.g. in the previous example the value for </span>`body`<span offset-key="cd28698efa8c46d48af87fe09aa353b3:3"> is URL encoded).</span></span>
