## 

<span key="e66d988349d342a2b4fc229c33d8cf06"><span offset-key="e66d988349d342a2b4fc229c33d8cf06:0">Remark plugins</span></span>

<span key="3d1626dc2e0c463586b6b35d6bf6de9d"><span offset-key="3d1626dc2e0c463586b6b35d6bf6de9d:0">You can register plugins to customize </span></span><a href="https://github.com/remarkjs/remark" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="37e11965f5fb419381ce5d5fb8ba9ea0" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="d35ee40df23c458b83d28982ece05f38"><code class="r-1vckr1u r-z2wwpe r-uibjmv r-m2pi6t r-1hvjb8t" data-slate-leaf="true" data-offset-key="d35ee40df23c458b83d28982ece05f38:0">remark</code></span></span></a><span key="984fb5a609424353bc58d6a1485805e1"><span offset-key="984fb5a609424353bc58d6a1485805e1:0">, the library used by the richtext editor for serializing and deserializing markdown.</span></span>

1

<span key="4b176752e18c412ea529aaf3c60e1b35"><span offset-key="4b176752e18c412ea529aaf3c60e1b35:0">// register a plugin</span></span>

2

<span key="749fa5ed95f44de0b298ee1b72126d0f"><span offset-key="749fa5ed95f44de0b298ee1b72126d0f:0">CMS.registerRemarkPlugin(plugin);</span></span>

3

<span key="41cfe34a28604da88cffbd7fdcc2c1a8"><span offset-key="41cfe34a28604da88cffbd7fdcc2c1a8:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

4

<span key="9c149b21ff8d463cb958e32ba3388c92"><span offset-key="9c149b21ff8d463cb958e32ba3388c92:0">// provide global settings to all plugins, e.g. for customizing \`remark-stringify\`</span></span>

5

<span key="59678e4aabdb4890a910ba25fd31afbf"><span offset-key="59678e4aabdb4890a910ba25fd31afbf:0">CMS.registerRemarkPlugin({ settings: { bullet: '-' } });</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="2e297a45067349549d4b9d6efb8b5049"><span offset-key="2e297a45067349549d4b9d6efb8b5049:0">Note that </span>`netlify-widget-markdown`<span offset-key="2e297a45067349549d4b9d6efb8b5049:2"> currently uses </span>`[email protected]`<span offset-key="2e297a45067349549d4b9d6efb8b5049:4">, so you should check a plugin's compatibility first.</span></span>

# 

<span key="9a65fc6bfa0b43da9d2c6cf017148568"><span offset-key="9a65fc6bfa0b43da9d2c6cf017148568:0">Add to Your Site</span></span>

<span key="8400cef7fa554d61906fccaae027451b"><span offset-key="8400cef7fa554d61906fccaae027451b:0">You can adapt Netlify CMS to a wide variety of projects. It works with any content written in markdown, JSON, YAML, or TOML files, stored in a repo on </span></span><a href="https://github.com" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="79f1b664d8e44090adbcf5b03d37ea08" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="9f9985d23d0c4e89bcc89e2469b3fd53"><span data-offset-key="9f9985d23d0c4e89bcc89e2469b3fd53:0">GitHub</span></span></span></a><span key="220323983d4d41eab2af7c915b42eddf"><span offset-key="220323983d4d41eab2af7c915b42eddf:0">, </span></span><a href="https://about.gitlab.com" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="b284a8d54494474a86eb12dfba52e542" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="c2c845c2ac6e47b0815e98e8b75a81d0"><span data-offset-key="c2c845c2ac6e47b0815e98e8b75a81d0:0">GitLab</span></span></span></a><span key="48462bf0aa62410b91315c45792ea7e7"><span offset-key="48462bf0aa62410b91315c45792ea7e7:0">, or </span></span><a href="https://bitbucket.org" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="04159c348c7a48e3a73138450213f2c7" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="c8b3df307062408a8d2837e692eff926"><span data-offset-key="c8b3df307062408a8d2837e692eff926:0">Bitbucket</span></span></span></a><span key="71e60ce3ada84cbb9e419d047d37f580"><span offset-key="71e60ce3ada84cbb9e419d047d37f580:0">. You can also create your own custom backend.</span></span>

<span key="86bc79ce133747d3b2390b8e671a1191"><span offset-key="86bc79ce133747d3b2390b8e671a1191:0">This tutorial guides you through the steps for adding Netlify CMS to a site that's built with a common </span></span><a href="https://www.staticgen.com" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="8c8412294f1a49319dad7b285bd7319d" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="b2bbc66fb6ed48ea9d3f0ee01201637b"><span data-offset-key="b2bbc66fb6ed48ea9d3f0ee01201637b:0">static site generator</span></span></span></a><span key="f0d0e42436ca4740aaf4a522ac9a7e44"><span offset-key="f0d0e42436ca4740aaf4a522ac9a7e44:0">, like Jekyll, Hugo, Hexo, or Gatsby. Alternatively, you can </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/start-with-a-template" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="665a7c4e28b04bb98a44f2e42281b737" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="9494ea0c93f749af85872ad507a273ca"><span data-offset-key="9494ea0c93f749af85872ad507a273ca:0">start from a template</span></span></span></a><span key="0efc4eeda1dc476aa3c3017630cb3bdc"><span offset-key="0efc4eeda1dc476aa3c3017630cb3bdc:0"> or dive right into </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/configuration-options" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="38d78f6453624f3486f4b7dc91c32b22" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="d027b87379b44ee9a937a9ca9bba790c"><span data-offset-key="d027b87379b44ee9a937a9ca9bba790c:0">configuration options</span></span></span></a><span key="ba76a196b78549b286cc377bef22da55"><span offset-key="ba76a196b78549b286cc377bef22da55:0">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="f3d3e5299de5461f92332af6fdd21b40"><span offset-key="f3d3e5299de5461f92332af6fdd21b40:0">App File Structure</span></span>

<span key="5dfb59c454664485ab333931bd23d3fe"><span offset-key="5dfb59c454664485ab333931bd23d3fe:0">A static </span>`admin`<span offset-key="5dfb59c454664485ab333931bd23d3fe:2"> folder contains all Netlify CMS files, stored at the root of your published site. Where you store this folder in the source files depends on your static site generator. Here's the static file location for a few of the most popular static site generators:</span></span>

These generators

store static files in

<span key="56431d4b53e74aa2868db6ef49d5b23c"><span offset-key="56431d4b53e74aa2868db6ef49d5b23c:0">Jekyll, GitBook</span></span>

<span key="dec915d9aed04c2fb344a77e04404f9f">`/`<span offset-key="dec915d9aed04c2fb344a77e04404f9f:1"> (project root)</span></span>

<span key="e7953139d3514479b464ad199ff7bc2a"><span offset-key="e7953139d3514479b464ad199ff7bc2a:0">Hugo, Gatsby, Nuxt, Gridsome, Zola, Sapper</span></span>

<span key="0832168114f340328cfa02998d40294f">`/static`</span>

<span key="5912dc7c2882428e9e2ee51f9dc35758"><span offset-key="5912dc7c2882428e9e2ee51f9dc35758:0">Next</span></span>

<span key="ce5d5b7bafe04569aee89fa67c93b5a9">`/public`</span>

<span key="e76f4f9ac65a41199659bf8dbfd2d8a2"><span offset-key="e76f4f9ac65a41199659bf8dbfd2d8a2:0">Hexo, Middleman, Jigsaw</span></span>

<span key="32ae1d3e16864aed9316481362041e3a">`/source`</span>

<span key="518b63041ab04e339f9e6f8ecb47cc85"><span offset-key="518b63041ab04e339f9e6f8ecb47cc85:0">Spike</span></span>

<span key="0b470342b4134f1f8c22ca21274537f1">`/views`</span>

<span key="412b1d153c9a4e369e7be637c11504aa"><span offset-key="412b1d153c9a4e369e7be637c11504aa:0">Wyam</span></span>

<span key="32e1ed50bcde4786afe391bf42dc656e">`/input`</span>

<span key="214f7cdfa0b94d2ba283bf03b0c9f234"><span offset-key="214f7cdfa0b94d2ba283bf03b0c9f234:0">Pelican</span></span>

<span key="c8cb854627d14b3295ac0271b976f31e">`/content`</span>

<span key="2378aad540024de58cc256552cbe98b8"><span offset-key="2378aad540024de58cc256552cbe98b8:0">VuePress</span></span>

<span key="23903690a2234739b8d324976af93602">`/.vuepress/public`</span>

<span key="1cff3e1ad54c4fcea3c403f2412492bf"><span offset-key="1cff3e1ad54c4fcea3c403f2412492bf:0">Elmstatic</span></span>

<span key="432df20c5ae546fdbe0fa14beaf970d3">`/_site`</span>

<span key="833d920e06b64b44a0640d85b50735c3"><span offset-key="833d920e06b64b44a0640d85b50735c3:0">11ty</span></span>

<span key="f17103a45928432eaf0a055b10b96b08">`/_site`</span>

<span key="923ab73767fc441db47068e9810440d6"><span offset-key="923ab73767fc441db47068e9810440d6:0">preact-cli</span></span>

<span key="f88c4bf342bc4e49a34bee2c39b5ab19">`/src/static`</span>

<span key="47e52da91b9e40fcb236063f762d87d1"><span offset-key="47e52da91b9e40fcb236063f762d87d1:0">If your generator isn't listed here, you can check its documentation, or as a shortcut, look in your project for a </span>`css`<span offset-key="47e52da91b9e40fcb236063f762d87d1:2"> or </span>`images`<span offset-key="47e52da91b9e40fcb236063f762d87d1:4"> folder. The contents of folders like that are usually processed as static files, so it's likely you can store your </span>`admin`<span offset-key="47e52da91b9e40fcb236063f762d87d1:6"> folder next to those. (When you've found the location, feel free to add it to these docs by </span></span><a href="https://github.com/netlify/netlify-cms/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="7075b7b25e224445bd3b53ec3dbddd94" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="1f18b23b298746b989ef96b33b838dd5"><span data-offset-key="1f18b23b298746b989ef96b33b838dd5:0">filing a pull request</span></span></span></a><span key="8e82de77c795442cb27254192f70f586"><span offset-key="8e82de77c795442cb27254192f70f586:0">!)</span></span>

<span key="83cf3aa75f604dfa956423ea884748ba"><span offset-key="83cf3aa75f604dfa956423ea884748ba:0">Inside the </span>`admin`<span offset-key="83cf3aa75f604dfa956423ea884748ba:2"> folder, you'll create two files:</span></span>

1

<span key="ca0142dd861448ff972766f2f5534624"><span offset-key="ca0142dd861448ff972766f2f5534624:0">admin</span></span>

2

<span key="f34025a08d91456589c036e22255e857"><span offset-key="f34025a08d91456589c036e22255e857:0"> ├ index.html</span></span>

3

<span key="bd19c2b5ca8c4bdbb8f002df92c4c12b"><span offset-key="bd19c2b5ca8c4bdbb8f002df92c4c12b:0"> └ config.yml</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="d6a507abdabb47d7a2c971adc95c68da"><span offset-key="d6a507abdabb47d7a2c971adc95c68da:0">The first file, </span>`admin/index.html`<span offset-key="d6a507abdabb47d7a2c971adc95c68da:2">, is the entry point for the Netlify CMS admin interface. This means that users navigate to </span>`yoursite.com/admin/`<span offset-key="d6a507abdabb47d7a2c971adc95c68da:4"> to access it. On the code side, it's a basic HTML starter page that loads the Netlify CMS JavaScript file. The second file, </span>`admin/config.yml`<span offset-key="d6a507abdabb47d7a2c971adc95c68da:6">, is the heart of your Netlify CMS installation, and a bit more complex. The </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/add-to-your-site/#configuration" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="9ab27013e0c7457097bd1d278858f66e" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="827a9fbbc5d44d16a2eafdac28453006"><span data-offset-key="827a9fbbc5d44d16a2eafdac28453006:0">Configuration</span></span></span></a><span key="3d14f044c34d487bb6bbe706bc82b9d7"><span offset-key="3d14f044c34d487bb6bbe706bc82b9d7:0"> section covers the details.</span></span>

<span key="843f15f61fb34d3983ebe29c5cf33f65"><span offset-key="843f15f61fb34d3983ebe29c5cf33f65:0">In this example, we pull the </span>`admin/index.html`<span offset-key="843f15f61fb34d3983ebe29c5cf33f65:2"> file from a public CDN.</span></span>

1

<span key="9042964bc492486781f574346dadcad1"><span offset-key="9042964bc492486781f574346dadcad1:0">&lt;!doctype html></span></span>

2

<span key="02bcbcf842a5435d8d1b9bc61bba904d"><span offset-key="02bcbcf842a5435d8d1b9bc61bba904d:0">&lt;html></span></span>

3

<span key="9f9f18b192b44d7aafaa6e43c4e0b799"><span offset-key="9f9f18b192b44d7aafaa6e43c4e0b799:0">&lt;head></span></span>

4

<span key="dbf9483cf0ec46e3955a2cdf1a530f82"><span offset-key="dbf9483cf0ec46e3955a2cdf1a530f82:0"> &lt;meta charset="utf-8" /></span></span>

5

<span key="f4605238db2b44dbb21d07fc287cc7a2"><span offset-key="f4605238db2b44dbb21d07fc287cc7a2:0"> &lt;meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0" /></span></span>

6

<span key="45e84b2fe85543c2a52b008cde25ee62"><span offset-key="45e84b2fe85543c2a52b008cde25ee62:0"> &lt;title>Content Manager&lt;/title></span></span>

7

<span key="24e1b66c4b0f4763864f578349720ee7"><span offset-key="24e1b66c4b0f4763864f578349720ee7:0">&lt;/head></span></span>

8

<span key="c31b790ba9bd4fc8ab9ea59636c4f2c4"><span offset-key="c31b790ba9bd4fc8ab9ea59636c4f2c4:0">&lt;body></span></span>

9

<span key="d735df7a83f841ae896f0136225ff7e9"><span offset-key="d735df7a83f841ae896f0136225ff7e9:0"> &lt;!-- Include the script that builds the page and powers Netlify CMS --></span></span>

10

<span key="b2bc94791a074600b4f96dbd56c384f1"><span offset-key="b2bc94791a074600b4f96dbd56c384f1:0"> &lt;script src="https://unpkg.com/<a href="../../../cdn-cgi/l/email-protection.html" class="__cf_email__">[email protected]</a>^2.0.0/dist/netlify-cms.js">&lt;/script></span></span>

11

<span key="7320b2fced3b42bb91cf89e17cb02571"><span offset-key="7320b2fced3b42bb91cf89e17cb02571:0">&lt;/body></span></span>

12

<span key="18af0db395374bb992834d20172806bf"><span offset-key="18af0db395374bb992834d20172806bf:0">&lt;/html></span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="5e0febdf71a64597815e348b54263339"><span offset-key="5e0febdf71a64597815e348b54263339:0">In the code above the </span>`script`<span offset-key="5e0febdf71a64597815e348b54263339:2"> is loaded from the </span>`unpkg`<span offset-key="5e0febdf71a64597815e348b54263339:4"> CDN. Should there be any issue, </span>`jsDelivr`<span offset-key="5e0febdf71a64597815e348b54263339:6"> can be used as an alternative source. Simply set the </span>`src`<span offset-key="5e0febdf71a64597815e348b54263339:8"> to </span>`https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/[email protected]^2.0.0/dist/netlify-cms.js`</span>

### 

<span key="4ad40ada129b4d89a2d3331568154a73"><span offset-key="4ad40ada129b4d89a2d3331568154a73:0">Installing with npm</span></span>

<span key="8882d6ae0ae14b6fb835d8126f5c89b7"><span offset-key="8882d6ae0ae14b6fb835d8126f5c89b7:0">You can also use Netlify CMS as an npm module. Wherever you import Netlify CMS, it automatically runs, taking over the current page. Make sure the script that imports it only runs on your CMS page. First install the package and save it to your project:</span></span>

1

<span key="c0bfa844e0fb45ffa2a5310f2248990a"><span offset-key="c0bfa844e0fb45ffa2a5310f2248990a:0">npm install netlify-cms-app --save</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="a02e6196d97b468b9e89805a635d33e1"><span offset-key="a02e6196d97b468b9e89805a635d33e1:0">Then import it (assuming your project has tooling for imports):</span></span>

1

<span key="b9ef9acf9f49413683262983dfe7eee4"><span offset-key="b9ef9acf9f49413683262983dfe7eee4:0">import CMS from 'netlify-cms-app'</span></span>

2

<span key="d512134d4a8b43188b975ede1c4138f7"><span offset-key="d512134d4a8b43188b975ede1c4138f7:0">// Initialize the CMS object</span></span>

3

<span key="6a758665ac444923ab64402a8a7e2a43"><span offset-key="6a758665ac444923ab64402a8a7e2a43:0">CMS.init()</span></span>

4

<span key="25d718bbf96b413ab0f3ae75fa5e8e86"><span offset-key="25d718bbf96b413ab0f3ae75fa5e8e86:0">// Now the registry is available via the CMS object.</span></span>

5

<span key="664baeceaaa24876b543b5961bec75b8"><span offset-key="664baeceaaa24876b543b5961bec75b8:0">CMS.registerPreviewTemplate('my-template', MyTemplate)</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

## 

<span key="6c103229bb8848608e6f7e37aaeb57ab"><span offset-key="6c103229bb8848608e6f7e37aaeb57ab:0">Configuration</span></span>

<span key="b472d266681c45e6b363df0dea6a65ea"><span offset-key="b472d266681c45e6b363df0dea6a65ea:0">Configuration is different for every site, so we'll break it down into parts. Add all the code snippets in this section to your </span>`admin/config.yml`<span offset-key="b472d266681c45e6b363df0dea6a65ea:2"> file.</span></span>

### 

<span key="f160b4e457114d6682a38676a3f31d2a"><span offset-key="f160b4e457114d6682a38676a3f31d2a:0">Backend</span></span>

<span key="7acf53948bba4b13af4a2a3612584b56"><span offset-key="7acf53948bba4b13af4a2a3612584b56:0">We're using </span></span><a href="https://www.netlify.com" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="358b8cecf6f64adc835cc2cf6a60bbf7" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="4b39e2ae4700482da71ebf4d8792766f"><span data-offset-key="4b39e2ae4700482da71ebf4d8792766f:0">Netlify</span></span></span></a><span key="7bcbf25b916c40989345e8643da01f75"><span offset-key="7bcbf25b916c40989345e8643da01f75:0"> for our hosting and authentication in this tutorial, so backend configuration is fairly straightforward.</span></span>

<span key="baa89682628742a29efaac96539cbf57"><span offset-key="baa89682628742a29efaac96539cbf57:0">For GitHub and GitLab repositories, you can start your Netlify CMS </span>`config.yml`<span offset-key="baa89682628742a29efaac96539cbf57:2"> file with these lines:</span></span>

1

<span key="88bdd116fc694a6a926fbc4c7da9d490"><span offset-key="88bdd116fc694a6a926fbc4c7da9d490:0">backend:</span></span>

2

<span key="61ea5ffbf32b45c7b72c1ad9ddb20249"><span offset-key="61ea5ffbf32b45c7b72c1ad9ddb20249:0"> name: git-gateway</span></span>

3

<span key="449d753c8edd4718aa87f3a1660175a0"><span offset-key="449d753c8edd4718aa87f3a1660175a0:0"> branch: master # Branch to update (optional; defaults to master)</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="61dbf3000c9846c9988ef2465ce57d44">*(For Bitbucket repositories, use the* </span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/bitbucket-backend" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="2121726f09ef4a79bad37f33127d5881" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="92c315c02f064448ac6f18fe624a129a"><em>Bitbucket backend</em></span></span></a><span key="7299cf8a9cde48269e392f4f3c61e46d"> *instructions instead.)*</span>

<span key="746adebd475a434b9ae8c78030c64652"><span offset-key="746adebd475a434b9ae8c78030c64652:0">The configuration above specifies your backend protocol and your publication branch. Git Gateway is an open source API that acts as a proxy between authenticated users of your site and your site repo. (We'll get to the details of that in the </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/add-to-your-site/#authentication" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="b994adfec33b4e1885dd40a6ea473ec6" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="68ed5a53889340dd837eaf43afaaad3c"><span data-offset-key="68ed5a53889340dd837eaf43afaaad3c:0">Authentication section</span></span></span></a><span key="cc48dc5001334573aac99dfd139c7631"><span offset-key="cc48dc5001334573aac99dfd139c7631:0"> below.) If you leave out the </span>`branch`<span offset-key="cc48dc5001334573aac99dfd139c7631:2"> declaration, it defaults to </span>`master`<span offset-key="cc48dc5001334573aac99dfd139c7631:4">.</span></span>

### 

<span key="d16eab5bcf3e4f30920b763f0121a42d"><span offset-key="d16eab5bcf3e4f30920b763f0121a42d:0">Editorial Workflow</span></span>

<span key="1166dc2c408647bfb14a493bdbd69083">**Note:**<span offset-key="1166dc2c408647bfb14a493bdbd69083:1"> Editorial workflow works with GitHub repositories, and support for GitLab and Bitbucket is </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/beta-features/#gitlab-and-bitbucket-editorial-workflow-support" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="a19abdca68e846528036f0107c1ffbeb" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="cdc4045023484fc2b1e450feedf6b60c"><span data-offset-key="cdc4045023484fc2b1e450feedf6b60c:0">in beta</span></span></span></a><span key="ea5cc175d0ab43bab7f83699ae388846"><span offset-key="ea5cc175d0ab43bab7f83699ae388846:0">.</span></span>

<span key="dc257091950345dca5f532578bd9268f"><span offset-key="dc257091950345dca5f532578bd9268f:0">By default, saving a post in the CMS interface pushes a commit directly to the publication branch specified in </span>`backend`<span offset-key="dc257091950345dca5f532578bd9268f:2">. However, you also have the option to enable the </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/configuration-options/#publish-mode" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="2f283f65b50448deb19aa4d997aaa61a" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="fbbce51a3f1149819480b4499e284732"><span data-offset-key="fbbce51a3f1149819480b4499e284732:0">Editorial Workflow</span></span></span></a><span key="b5e84c090609499c9b6f1ebcc665c972"><span offset-key="b5e84c090609499c9b6f1ebcc665c972:0">, which adds an interface for drafting, reviewing, and approving posts. To do this, add the following line to your Netlify CMS </span>`config.yml`<span offset-key="b5e84c090609499c9b6f1ebcc665c972:2">:</span></span>

1

<span key="a3b0c9b267ce421abb14f49ef03be5cd"><span offset-key="a3b0c9b267ce421abb14f49ef03be5cd:0"># This line should \*not\* be indented</span></span>

2

<span key="b2b11aeb19b84672819b84b6f69527b4"><span offset-key="b2b11aeb19b84672819b84b6f69527b4:0">publish\_mode: editorial\_workflow</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

### 

<span key="ab9d2628600b40969a6479e3e09b0abf"><span offset-key="ab9d2628600b40969a6479e3e09b0abf:0">Media and Public Folders</span></span>

<span key="cd3a25188b7f45778c9e7c94af498223"><span offset-key="cd3a25188b7f45778c9e7c94af498223:0">Netlify CMS allows users to upload images directly within the editor. For this to work, the CMS needs to know where to save them. If you already have an </span>`images`<span offset-key="cd3a25188b7f45778c9e7c94af498223:2"> folder in your project, you could use its path, possibly creating an </span>`uploads`<span offset-key="cd3a25188b7f45778c9e7c94af498223:4"> sub-folder, for example:</span></span>

1

<span key="74026a5cfe564bfcbbe5bb97f9ac2a46"><span offset-key="74026a5cfe564bfcbbe5bb97f9ac2a46:0"># This line should \*not\* be indented</span></span>

2

<span key="039c9c74456a46e2a21eb005c8d84a3b"><span offset-key="039c9c74456a46e2a21eb005c8d84a3b:0">media\_folder: "images/uploads" # Media files will be stored in the repo under images/uploads</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="61605979737244749fbe90ce26a2c2f2"><span offset-key="61605979737244749fbe90ce26a2c2f2:0">If you're creating a new folder for uploaded media, you'll need to know where your static site generator expects static files. You can refer to the paths outlined above in </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/add-to-your-site/#app-file-structure" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="57c2d9f3f0c3460c984d4457c5bf007b" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="41a475c4d7a2459fafe35a821cdb5da6"><span data-offset-key="41a475c4d7a2459fafe35a821cdb5da6:0">App File Structure</span></span></span></a><span key="4f21780772a944fb98d5b39d9cf3b676"><span offset-key="4f21780772a944fb98d5b39d9cf3b676:0">, and put your media folder in the same location where you put the </span>`admin`<span offset-key="4f21780772a944fb98d5b39d9cf3b676:2"> folder.</span></span>

<span key="87a93022bdde4688af3fb3e11f6d5148"><span offset-key="87a93022bdde4688af3fb3e11f6d5148:0">Note that the</span>`media_folder`<span offset-key="87a93022bdde4688af3fb3e11f6d5148:2"> file path is relative to the project root, so the example above would work for Jekyll, GitBook, or any other generator that stores static files at the project root. However, it would not work for Hugo, Hexo, Middleman or others that store static files in a subfolder. Here's an example that could work for a Hugo site:</span></span>

1

<span key="1662bec0e8284b35a8cd3058a34d61e0"><span offset-key="1662bec0e8284b35a8cd3058a34d61e0:0"># These lines should \*not\* be indented</span></span>

2

<span key="07a9f3e5f5d94e1782172e29014ec2b1"><span offset-key="07a9f3e5f5d94e1782172e29014ec2b1:0">media\_folder: "static/images/uploads" # Media files will be stored in the repo under static/images/uploads</span></span>

3

<span key="cc7e2315b25b4ff68ca550247e1e7f29"><span offset-key="cc7e2315b25b4ff68ca550247e1e7f29:0">public\_folder: "/images/uploads" # The src attribute for uploaded media will begin with /images/uploads</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="820ebba6638641678b8513e8322380b1"><span offset-key="820ebba6638641678b8513e8322380b1:0">The configuration above adds a new setting, </span>`public_folder`<span offset-key="820ebba6638641678b8513e8322380b1:2">. While </span>`media_folder`<span offset-key="820ebba6638641678b8513e8322380b1:4"> specifies where uploaded files are saved in the repo, </span>`public_folder`<span offset-key="820ebba6638641678b8513e8322380b1:6"> indicates where they are found in the published site. Image </span>`src`<span offset-key="820ebba6638641678b8513e8322380b1:8"> attributes use this path, which is relative to the file where it's called. For this reason, we usually start the path at the site root, using the opening </span>`/`<span offset-key="820ebba6638641678b8513e8322380b1:10">.</span></span>

<span key="294e30cea9234dd8a787adaf3384d82f">*If* `public_folder` *is not set, Netlify CMS defaults to the same value as* `media_folder`*, adding an opening* `/` *if one is not included.*</span>

### 

<span key="812d6745fcfa40bfa0e8c4ba7fdc0347"><span offset-key="812d6745fcfa40bfa0e8c4ba7fdc0347:0">Collections</span></span>

<span key="5a728b05e0fa4dca8c82526e2f1bbbf9"><span offset-key="5a728b05e0fa4dca8c82526e2f1bbbf9:0">Collections define the structure for the different content types on your static site. Since every site is different, the </span>`collections`<span offset-key="5a728b05e0fa4dca8c82526e2f1bbbf9:2"> settings differ greatly from one site to the next.</span></span>

<span key="4d004e0b93fb466b9852207f96e6edaf"><span offset-key="4d004e0b93fb466b9852207f96e6edaf:0">Let's say your site has a blog, with the posts stored in </span>`_posts/blog`<span offset-key="4d004e0b93fb466b9852207f96e6edaf:2">, and files saved in a date-title format, like </span>`1999-12-31-lets-party.md`<span offset-key="4d004e0b93fb466b9852207f96e6edaf:4">. Each post begins with settings in yaml-formatted front matter, like so:</span></span>

1

<span key="132c3903d18344cd9038548c989d8002"><span offset-key="132c3903d18344cd9038548c989d8002:0">---</span></span>

2

<span key="5dcb27d14e04413794a4f32e72be2881"><span offset-key="5dcb27d14e04413794a4f32e72be2881:0">layout: blog</span></span>

3

<span key="f31a4e90740d404aa3a8b02eedee87d3"><span offset-key="f31a4e90740d404aa3a8b02eedee87d3:0">title: "Let's Party"</span></span>

4

<span key="64c74ae2b93242ed888c1e5f82dd041e"><span offset-key="64c74ae2b93242ed888c1e5f82dd041e:0">date: 1999-12-31 11:59:59 -0800</span></span>

5

<span key="efcb33b21c834be09e34df7ce09f045c"><span offset-key="efcb33b21c834be09e34df7ce09f045c:0">thumbnail: "/images/prince.jpg"</span></span>

6

<span key="a968002d51514b8d86be61e753ee283d"><span offset-key="a968002d51514b8d86be61e753ee283d:0">rating: 5</span></span>

7

<span key="4b75c33a59d1498bb9da0b164dc0c60f"><span offset-key="4b75c33a59d1498bb9da0b164dc0c60f:0">---</span></span>

8

<span key="e28d3ba12abe41d29cc0b7e603fc9996"><span offset-key="e28d3ba12abe41d29cc0b7e603fc9996:0"><span slate-zero-width="n">​</span></span></span>

9

<span key="981ed23a86f1422b8c057c8f00d84283"><span offset-key="981ed23a86f1422b8c057c8f00d84283:0">This is the post body, where I write about our last chance to party before the Y2K bug destroys us all.</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="31354364eb0b40d59706b6ed2ea3678f"><span offset-key="31354364eb0b40d59706b6ed2ea3678f:0">Given this example, our </span>`collections`<span offset-key="31354364eb0b40d59706b6ed2ea3678f:2"> settings would look like this in your NetlifyCMS </span>`config.yml`<span offset-key="31354364eb0b40d59706b6ed2ea3678f:4"> file:</span></span>

1

<span key="5c87713980ba468684530d979ac6eea0"><span offset-key="5c87713980ba468684530d979ac6eea0:0">collections:</span></span>

2

<span key="724aee29a54446939beadf9c598c6488"><span offset-key="724aee29a54446939beadf9c598c6488:0"> - name: "blog" # Used in routes, e.g., /admin/collections/blog</span></span>

3

<span key="12f077fafcfe4614a979410e43bb89c1"><span offset-key="12f077fafcfe4614a979410e43bb89c1:0"> label: "Blog" # Used in the UI</span></span>

4

<span key="3e2227d53d914fb8b5321376c0259a1a"><span offset-key="3e2227d53d914fb8b5321376c0259a1a:0"> folder: "\_posts/blog" # The path to the folder where the documents are stored</span></span>

5

<span key="9b02a44bd25549b88a743c344097d876"><span offset-key="9b02a44bd25549b88a743c344097d876:0"> create: true # Allow users to create new documents in this collection</span></span>

6

<span key="dda075c43c62407d918698117b6016b8"><span offset-key="dda075c43c62407d918698117b6016b8:0"> slug: "{{year}}-{{month}}-{{day}}-{{slug}}" # Filename template, e.g., YYYY-MM-DD-title.md</span></span>

7

<span key="09e9b25bcd4a47e2b90b7cd04773633d"><span offset-key="09e9b25bcd4a47e2b90b7cd04773633d:0"> fields: # The fields for each document, usually in front matter</span></span>

8

<span key="a77e879dec194fb7ba1dbeb470eee8ba"><span offset-key="a77e879dec194fb7ba1dbeb470eee8ba:0"> - {label: "Layout", name: "layout", widget: "hidden", default: "blog"}</span></span>

9

<span key="199509886ecc4a12ac9186f5975b9b75"><span offset-key="199509886ecc4a12ac9186f5975b9b75:0"> - {label: "Title", name: "title", widget: "string"}</span></span>

10

<span key="a85e0f052c1049088a2f9ce910abd9b3"><span offset-key="a85e0f052c1049088a2f9ce910abd9b3:0"> - {label: "Publish Date", name: "date", widget: "datetime"}</span></span>

11

<span key="e2680db5b5724782a91caf46d7438539"><span offset-key="e2680db5b5724782a91caf46d7438539:0"> - {label: "Featured Image", name: "thumbnail", widget: "image"}</span></span>

12

<span key="da29e5a593304f8b84f98bfb524e1a4d"><span offset-key="da29e5a593304f8b84f98bfb524e1a4d:0"> - {label: "Rating (scale of 1-5)", name: "rating", widget: "number"}</span></span>

13

<span key="dee065c0e27742eaa909db2a9a3c6a8a"><span offset-key="dee065c0e27742eaa909db2a9a3c6a8a:0"> - {label: "Body", name: "body", widget: "markdown"}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="9e9cd390091b4107a20ff98e4f4113f7"><span offset-key="9e9cd390091b4107a20ff98e4f4113f7:0">Let's break that down:</span></span>

<span key="3215df4b0827488faf225e801dfc2bb4">`name`</span>

<span key="31140e0a90d94829b8e5eeae4a4bd6c2"><span offset-key="31140e0a90d94829b8e5eeae4a4bd6c2:0">Post type identifier, used in routes. Must be unique.</span></span>

<span key="57734ce336dc4b2c883373803f771c13">`label`</span>

<span key="fde1b30469a14aa29d15705aaddb7d1d"><span offset-key="fde1b30469a14aa29d15705aaddb7d1d:0">What the admin UI calls the post type.</span></span>

<span key="a8ac9025bfee4ddbb3031f266e1fd89f">`folder`</span>

<span key="ad0e5fd45aaf4731926378c99c5ef724"><span offset-key="ad0e5fd45aaf4731926378c99c5ef724:0">Where files of this type are stored, relative to the repo root.</span></span>

<span key="dcd5fd1869404f5d8b236955f4a0e99b">`create`</span>

<span key="e45b1f2af883420abb8e92693f52ddc6"><span offset-key="e45b1f2af883420abb8e92693f52ddc6:0">Set to </span>`true`<span offset-key="e45b1f2af883420abb8e92693f52ddc6:2"> to allow users to create new files in this collection.</span></span>

<span key="60df0090fef340f8aea483efdc394338">`slug`</span>

<span key="83a32373de7444f99f5473a94966ad40"><span offset-key="83a32373de7444f99f5473a94966ad40:0">Template for filenames. </span>`{{year}}`<span offset-key="83a32373de7444f99f5473a94966ad40:2">, </span>`{{month}}`<span offset-key="83a32373de7444f99f5473a94966ad40:4">, and </span>`{{day}}`<span offset-key="83a32373de7444f99f5473a94966ad40:6"> pulls from the post's </span>`date`<span offset-key="83a32373de7444f99f5473a94966ad40:8"> field or save date. </span>`{{slug}}`<span offset-key="83a32373de7444f99f5473a94966ad40:10"> is a url-safe version of the post's </span>`title`<span offset-key="83a32373de7444f99f5473a94966ad40:12">. Default is simply </span>`{{slug}}`<span offset-key="83a32373de7444f99f5473a94966ad40:14">.</span></span>

<span key="922cd2b40b8e4721a94b4e66c7791318">`fields`</span>

<span key="fe0f3f52a4424af6b262f2d616691499"><span offset-key="fe0f3f52a4424af6b262f2d616691499:0">Fields listed here are shown as fields in the content editor, then saved as front matter at the beginning of the document (except for </span>`body`<span offset-key="fe0f3f52a4424af6b262f2d616691499:2">, which follows the front matter). Each field contains the following properties:</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="2fe59f4925b342948a5e3fa2d6b6099f">`label`<span offset-key="2fe59f4925b342948a5e3fa2d6b6099f:1">: Field label in the editor UI.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="41c78e636597495092f439b4c8b25f87">`name`<span offset-key="41c78e636597495092f439b4c8b25f87:1">: Field name in the document front matter.</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="73c8fd497b5b4ca39582a0c935845734">`widget`<span offset-key="73c8fd497b5b4ca39582a0c935845734:1">: Determines UI style and value data type (details below).</span></span>

-   <img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-1nf4jbm r-1vzi8xi" />

    <span key="eb899a63d3994d87bcbc21a0200fc3e0">`default`<span offset-key="eb899a63d3994d87bcbc21a0200fc3e0:1"> (optional): Sets a default value for the field.</span></span>

<span key="fb6a00376f5d46bf8b0b0b06cf49b0c8"><span offset-key="fb6a00376f5d46bf8b0b0b06cf49b0c8:0">As described above, the </span>`widget`<span offset-key="fb6a00376f5d46bf8b0b0b06cf49b0c8:2"> property specifies a built-in or custom UI widget for a given field. When a content editor enters a value into a widget, that value is saved in the document front matter as the value for the </span>`name`<span offset-key="fb6a00376f5d46bf8b0b0b06cf49b0c8:4"> specified for that field. A full listing of available widgets can be found in the </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/widgets" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="89f79c8bd34c43d58ad3917e69d0a13d" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="1ec2f57f696a443d9d48727b7c0112b4"><span data-offset-key="1ec2f57f696a443d9d48727b7c0112b4:0">Widgets doc</span></span></span></a><span key="1299fdbd88804a5985091c8293838459"><span offset-key="1299fdbd88804a5985091c8293838459:0">.</span></span>

<span key="77e55e974bbf4501ae8676ab203e46c0"><span offset-key="77e55e974bbf4501ae8676ab203e46c0:0">Based on this example, you can go through the post types in your site and add the appropriate settings to your Netlify CMS </span>`config.yml`<span offset-key="77e55e974bbf4501ae8676ab203e46c0:2"> file. Each post type should be listed as a separate node under the </span>`collections`<span offset-key="77e55e974bbf4501ae8676ab203e46c0:4"> field. See the </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/configuration-options/#collections" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="b340da72bcaa4e3a802fca066e8c90d2" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="0c48b4f716134c53bcc74962cf24dc4b"><span data-offset-key="0c48b4f716134c53bcc74962cf24dc4b:0">Collections reference doc</span></span></span></a><span key="34989af586c2431fa6fafcdd0971a1b6"><span offset-key="34989af586c2431fa6fafcdd0971a1b6:0"> for more configuration options.</span></span>

### 

<span key="ffbb5c1391024877ba5be8ddca83a47b"><span offset-key="ffbb5c1391024877ba5be8ddca83a47b:0">Filter</span></span>

<span key="7abcadf9755940c49122241b8fa62395"><span offset-key="7abcadf9755940c49122241b8fa62395:0">The entries for any collection can be filtered based on the value of a single field. The example collection below only shows post entries with the value </span>`en`<span offset-key="7abcadf9755940c49122241b8fa62395:2"> in the </span>`language`<span offset-key="7abcadf9755940c49122241b8fa62395:4"> field.</span></span>

1

<span key="8881d2ed686947e2a2ee6ffea3f95e4a"><span offset-key="8881d2ed686947e2a2ee6ffea3f95e4a:0">collections:</span></span>

2

<span key="7d2f9fc2a74447dd8ddf6e9d42885775"><span offset-key="7d2f9fc2a74447dd8ddf6e9d42885775:0"> - name: "posts"</span></span>

3

<span key="75420a56c9cc41b1982e319f56010999"><span offset-key="75420a56c9cc41b1982e319f56010999:0"> label: "Post"</span></span>

4

<span key="0b42a522ec6e44e0b3dd09307f2030f9"><span offset-key="0b42a522ec6e44e0b3dd09307f2030f9:0"> folder: "\_posts"</span></span>

5

<span key="14ad0d9bbfbf41d08a8b8dbb15d4d222"><span offset-key="14ad0d9bbfbf41d08a8b8dbb15d4d222:0"> filter:</span></span>

6

<span key="e3e4a79b688a4391bce54d1a60c39519"><span offset-key="e3e4a79b688a4391bce54d1a60c39519:0"> field: language</span></span>

7

<span key="d57856eb3d9d42b7aad1945132948305"><span offset-key="d57856eb3d9d42b7aad1945132948305:0"> value: en</span></span>

8

<span key="547ba5c94b6146e4b46a99ea0e165a04"><span offset-key="547ba5c94b6146e4b46a99ea0e165a04:0"> fields:</span></span>

9

<span key="d08adb295fef442cb9740cbcbb3e20ea"><span offset-key="d08adb295fef442cb9740cbcbb3e20ea:0"> - {label: "Language", name: "language"}</span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

## 

<span key="b4241fbd6d2846f3bcc81677dac2caf0"><span offset-key="b4241fbd6d2846f3bcc81677dac2caf0:0">Authentication</span></span>

<span key="dff17103070541c586dab820ed7a20f4"><span offset-key="dff17103070541c586dab820ed7a20f4:0">Now that you have your Netlify CMS files in place and configured, all that's left is to enable authentication. We're using the </span></span><a href="https://www.netlify.com" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="1404cbb69b944e4b85d86fdcbb1a56a1" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="9a61192d38d8478b908068af70ae9521"><span data-offset-key="9a61192d38d8478b908068af70ae9521:0">Netlify</span></span></span></a><span key="403620627c3148a891b50888184823a0"><span offset-key="403620627c3148a891b50888184823a0:0"> platform here because it's one of the quickest ways to get started, but you can learn about other authentication options in the </span></span><a href="https://www.netlifycms.org/docs/backends-overview" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="aa13c047f02246cb97008b255187859e" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="a45c9ef067774f9d8439846ddea48657"><span data-offset-key="a45c9ef067774f9d8439846ddea48657:0">Backends</span></span></span></a><span key="17c6c5bb46de4077827add8edff2bcbe"><span offset-key="17c6c5bb46de4077827add8edff2bcbe:0"> doc.</span></span>

### 

<span key="8ee78f76847b49e99a717011d888d8c9"><span offset-key="8ee78f76847b49e99a717011d888d8c9:0">Setup on Netlify</span></span>

<span key="77a5f78fd2384442a5056dbd43c709ad"><span offset-key="77a5f78fd2384442a5056dbd43c709ad:0">Netlify offers a built-in authentication service called Identity. In order to use it, connect your site repo with Netlify. Netlify has published a general </span></span><a href="https://www.netlify.com/blog/2016/10/27/a-step-by-step-guide-deploying-a-static-site-or-single-page-app/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="6ea0caabbc874c6bba542c9a0d380a02" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="cae1bff696a647b4b1c4d676a02513d7"><span data-offset-key="cae1bff696a647b4b1c4d676a02513d7:0">Step-by-Step Guide</span></span></span></a><span key="e0d887d7a3e041bb8740f38121d017e7"><span offset-key="e0d887d7a3e041bb8740f38121d017e7:0"> for this, along with detailed guides for many popular static site generators, including </span></span><a href="https://www.netlify.com/blog/2015/10/28/a-step-by-step-guide-jekyll-3.0-on-netlify/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="fa54dbb478fb48848e6121dd561c20f1" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="31402de83eee49cc99aacc5262505830"><span data-offset-key="31402de83eee49cc99aacc5262505830:0">Jekyll</span></span></span></a><span key="73a1e34b059b4e65a424ce2b036321a4"><span offset-key="73a1e34b059b4e65a424ce2b036321a4:0">, </span></span><a href="https://www.netlify.com/blog/2016/09/21/a-step-by-step-guide-victor-hugo-on-netlify/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="b6f9c81b26614ed4bf585990aeb15724" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="9277a33a122f492e963fa6d583cade29"><span data-offset-key="9277a33a122f492e963fa6d583cade29:0">Hugo</span></span></span></a><span key="9f2ee043cfd24e30acfc01db6304def3"><span offset-key="9f2ee043cfd24e30acfc01db6304def3:0">, </span></span><a href="https://www.netlify.com/blog/2015/10/26/a-step-by-step-guide-hexo-on-netlify/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="c2f21ef3be4345519695db0363c00eb2" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="08070a9730d74894b37cc24df50338b3"><span data-offset-key="08070a9730d74894b37cc24df50338b3:0">Hexo</span></span></span></a><span key="85d79b68a97d427cb79caa28e1cbeab0"><span offset-key="85d79b68a97d427cb79caa28e1cbeab0:0">, </span></span><a href="https://www.netlify.com/blog/2015/10/01/a-step-by-step-guide-middleman-on-netlify/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="0b1b5a13933e4519909b89d4a17522cb" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="7478d216b53646ae9d4afc168b8b03b4"><span data-offset-key="7478d216b53646ae9d4afc168b8b03b4:0">Middleman</span></span></span></a><span key="17d873e963cc4d029301102e1d36268b"><span offset-key="17d873e963cc4d029301102e1d36268b:0">, </span></span><a href="https://www.netlify.com/blog/2016/02/24/a-step-by-step-guide-gatsby-on-netlify/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="2541daf1fc08476dacdb67cdb0bf046e" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="af38d99062a740a2bee4c21e2381c2a8"><span data-offset-key="af38d99062a740a2bee4c21e2381c2a8:0">Gatsby</span></span></span></a><span key="3627c1e22ed4467ab05a3b91a469929b"><span offset-key="3627c1e22ed4467ab05a3b91a469929b:0">, and more.</span></span>

### 

<span key="64ca805082b84af4a548b49b95d585bb"><span offset-key="64ca805082b84af4a548b49b95d585bb:0">Enable Identity and Git Gateway</span></span>

<span key="edb41e40f3434395b684da1d90f21b51"><span offset-key="edb41e40f3434395b684da1d90f21b51:0">Netlify's Identity and Git Gateway services allow you to manage CMS admin users for your site without requiring them to have an account with your Git host or commit access on your repo. From your site dashboard on Netlify:</span></span>

1.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">1.</span>
    <span key="6a59a07a5adc4c498a5c057a46384e3f"><span offset-key="6a59a07a5adc4c498a5c057a46384e3f:0">Go to </span>**Settings > Identity**<span offset-key="6a59a07a5adc4c498a5c057a46384e3f:2">, and select </span>**Enable Identity service**<span offset-key="6a59a07a5adc4c498a5c057a46384e3f:4">.</span></span>

2.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">2.</span>
    <span key="d5b9baa7ab754c549c7462f99d943f54"><span offset-key="d5b9baa7ab754c549c7462f99d943f54:0">Under </span>**Registration preferences**<span offset-key="d5b9baa7ab754c549c7462f99d943f54:2">, select </span>**Open**<span offset-key="d5b9baa7ab754c549c7462f99d943f54:4"> or </span>**Invite only**<span offset-key="d5b9baa7ab754c549c7462f99d943f54:6">. In most cases, you want only invited users to access your CMS, but if you're just experimenting, you can leave it open for convenience.</span></span>

3.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">3.</span>
    <span key="60e64652c5634a75a3184b2b49f50b98"><span offset-key="60e64652c5634a75a3184b2b49f50b98:0">If you'd like to allow one-click login with services like Google and GitHub, check the boxes next to the services you'd like to use, under </span>**External providers**<span offset-key="60e64652c5634a75a3184b2b49f50b98:2">.</span></span>

4.  <span class="r-1awozwy r-1nf4jbm r-6koalj r-18u37iz r-gg6oyi r-ubezar r-16dba41 r-135wba7 r-1m04atk r-1pyaxff" contenteditable="false" style="height:24px">4.</span>
    <span key="f72fe33c12bd4af09aa462d2d897c653"><span offset-key="f72fe33c12bd4af09aa462d2d897c653:0">Scroll down to </span>**Services > Git Gateway**<span offset-key="f72fe33c12bd4af09aa462d2d897c653:2">, and click </span>**Enable Git Gateway**<span offset-key="f72fe33c12bd4af09aa462d2d897c653:4">. This authenticates with your Git host and generates an API access token. In this case, we're leaving the </span>**Roles**<span offset-key="f72fe33c12bd4af09aa462d2d897c653:6"> field blank, which means any logged in user may access the CMS. For information on changing this, check the </span></span><a href="https://www.netlify.com/docs/identity/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="ccaf43b07c004a88a63e214f4eb47c5e" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="024ad4b041cd42e48ba3e4d7776cf598"><span data-offset-key="024ad4b041cd42e48ba3e4d7776cf598:0">Netlify Identity documentation</span></span></span></a><span key="b7231f64864541988f4eed9d445261dc"><span offset-key="b7231f64864541988f4eed9d445261dc:0">.</span></span>

### 

<span key="f0228b26afa34994b3cef53be9a71cbc"><span offset-key="f0228b26afa34994b3cef53be9a71cbc:0">Add the Netlify Identity Widget</span></span>

<span key="b4e0c0279e7b4674b77f36fc2ba1fe49"><span offset-key="b4e0c0279e7b4674b77f36fc2ba1fe49:0">With the backend set to handle authentication, now you need a frontend interface to connect to it. The open source Netlify Identity Widget is a drop-in widget made for just this purpose. To include the widget in your site, add the following script tag in two places:</span></span>

1

<span key="5192a16bb1d74c738d7cb19225e1ff6c"><span offset-key="5192a16bb1d74c738d7cb19225e1ff6c:0">&lt;script src="https://identity.netlify.com/v1/netlify-identity-widget.js">&lt;/script></span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="5bc1389623184094afc75840aba44018"><span offset-key="5bc1389623184094afc75840aba44018:0">Add this to the </span>`<head>`<span offset-key="5bc1389623184094afc75840aba44018:2"> of your CMS index page at </span>`/admin/index.html`<span offset-key="5bc1389623184094afc75840aba44018:4">, as well as the </span>`<head>`<span offset-key="5bc1389623184094afc75840aba44018:6"> of your site's main index page. Depending on how your site generator is set up, this may mean you need to add it to the default template, or to a "partial" or "include" template. If you can find where the site stylesheet is linked, that's probably the right place. Alternatively, you can include the script in your site using Netlify's </span></span><a href="https://www.netlify.com/docs/inject-analytics-snippets/" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="0c9bda153cee4f039ae8831564297bf9" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="ed67cd3eeea04b79aa3e83e14a240919"><span data-offset-key="ed67cd3eeea04b79aa3e83e14a240919:0">Script Injection</span></span></span></a><span key="54dd62fee044444e86c8410c1d109fc7"><span offset-key="54dd62fee044444e86c8410c1d109fc7:0"> feature.</span></span>

<span key="821f4c0bb5d94cfc84a3d0cf0232d34c"><span offset-key="821f4c0bb5d94cfc84a3d0cf0232d34c:0">When a user logs in with the Netlify Identity widget, an access token directs to the site homepage. In order to complete the login and get back to the CMS, redirect the user back to the </span>`/admin/`<span offset-key="821f4c0bb5d94cfc84a3d0cf0232d34c:2"> path. To do this, add the following script before the closing </span>`body`<span offset-key="821f4c0bb5d94cfc84a3d0cf0232d34c:4"> tag of your site's main index page:</span></span>

1

<span key="01de71d93b4342209a3b11b94a67f45f"><span offset-key="01de71d93b4342209a3b11b94a67f45f:0">&lt;script></span></span>

2

<span key="0cfa26213ac048f3a69ecda8772d0069"><span offset-key="0cfa26213ac048f3a69ecda8772d0069:0"> if (window.netlifyIdentity) {</span></span>

3

<span key="91526d6e3293456e9f4dbfacbf13b914"><span offset-key="91526d6e3293456e9f4dbfacbf13b914:0"> window.netlifyIdentity.on("init", user => {</span></span>

4

<span key="298bc8e3cf584a8b987c58fb28ccc4e9"><span offset-key="298bc8e3cf584a8b987c58fb28ccc4e9:0"> if (!user) {</span></span>

5

<span key="f32a491371e54dfa937cf1e8f25d8981"><span offset-key="f32a491371e54dfa937cf1e8f25d8981:0"> window.netlifyIdentity.on("login", () => {</span></span>

6

<span key="12e4c23c41b9439c8de07ef683ceaeed"><span offset-key="12e4c23c41b9439c8de07ef683ceaeed:0"> document.location.href = "/admin/";</span></span>

7

<span key="3510e0decfa548d7a693ae1283aea205"><span offset-key="3510e0decfa548d7a693ae1283aea205:0"> });</span></span>

8

<span key="f9ffb78ef018442e9f3107be80324fdf"><span offset-key="f9ffb78ef018442e9f3107be80324fdf:0"> }</span></span>

9

<span key="504966de2b7f4373acfdf12794a0330f"><span offset-key="504966de2b7f4373acfdf12794a0330f:0"> });</span></span>

10

<span key="a728d78228a04b3a80d21a81261d94e4"><span offset-key="a728d78228a04b3a80d21a81261d94e4:0"> }</span></span>

11

<span key="29fa7c24928d4bac9492e08727f41d41"><span offset-key="29fa7c24928d4bac9492e08727f41d41:0">&lt;/script></span></span>

<img src="data:image/svg+xml;base64," class="r-h7gdob r-10ptun7 r-1vzi8xi" />

Copied!

<span key="ce164d67b58b423198440256b908a2e2"><span offset-key="ce164d67b58b423198440256b908a2e2:0">Note: This example script requires modern JavaScript and does not work on IE11. For legacy browser support, use function expressions (</span>`function () {}`<span offset-key="ce164d67b58b423198440256b908a2e2:2">) in place of the arrow functions (</span>`() => {}`<span offset-key="ce164d67b58b423198440256b908a2e2:4">), or use a transpiler such as </span></span><a href="https://babeljs.io" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1loqt21 r-1471scf r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"><span data-key="04f842a7a5ea4aa089e5c1153b743bd4" data-rnw-int-class="nearest_257-44102_259-44103-237__"><span data-key="4dc8564a9e1a4bf3bc0c1478178d3cf9"><span data-offset-key="4dc8564a9e1a4bf3bc0c1478178d3cf9:0">Babel</span></span></span></a><span key="8e39efbc15364a768e99cb4e3ca3ccbe"><span offset-key="8e39efbc15364a768e99cb4e3ca3ccbe:0">.</span></span>

## 

<span key="44be75b546ec4b57bfca4ae4928c10fd"><span offset-key="44be75b546ec4b57bfca4ae4928c10fd:0">Accessing the CMS</span></span>

<span key="540dfcd0860a4990b861f69a80506861"><span offset-key="540dfcd0860a4990b861f69a80506861:0">Your site CMS is now fully configured and ready for login!</span></span>

<span key="b35cbe23eeb749ba9cdc3956c7923d2b"><span offset-key="b35cbe23eeb749ba9cdc3956c7923d2b:0">If you set your registration preference to "Invite only," invite yourself (and anyone else you choose) as a site user. To do this, select the </span>**Identity**<span offset-key="b35cbe23eeb749ba9cdc3956c7923d2b:2"> tab from your site dashboard, and then select the </span>**Invite users**<span offset-key="b35cbe23eeb749ba9cdc3956c7923d2b:4"> button. Invited users receive an email invitation with a confirmation link. Clicking the link will take you to your site with a login prompt.</span></span>

<span key="ab144353f2194d3980765c0f195e20e3"><span offset-key="ab144353f2194d3980765c0f195e20e3:0">If you left your site registration open, or for return visits after confirming an email invitation, access your site's CMS at </span>`yoursite.com/admin/`<span offset-key="ab144353f2194d3980765c0f195e20e3:2">.</span></span>

<span key="bb0696162f784c0fae016157959ce9bd">**Note:**<span offset-key="bb0696162f784c0fae016157959ce9bd:1"> No matter where you access Netlify CMS — whether running locally, in a staging environment, or in your published site — it always fetches and commits files in your hosted repository (for example, on GitHub), on the branch you configured in your Netlify CMS config.yml file. This means that content fetched in the admin UI matches the content in the repository, which may be different from your locally running site. It also means that content saved using the admin UI saves directly to the hosted repository, even if you're running the UI locally or in staging.</span></span>

<a href="open-authoring.html" class="css-4rbku5 css-1dbjc4n r-1awozwy r-14lw9ot r-190qawg r-z2wwpe r-rs99b7 r-4dj0k7 r-1loqt21 r-1quu1zo r-1ro0kt6 r-18u37iz r-16y2uox r-1wbh5a2 r-nsbfu8 r-1otgn73 r-1i6wzkk r-lrvibr"></a>
